The crops that she harvests are primarily for her family's consumption and if there are any left over she sells them.

Carmen will invest her loan in buying fertilizer, seeds and animal feed.  Her goal is to some day own a restaurant as she really enjoys cooking and would like to please other people with her good cooking.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and animal feed

loans.name: La Propuesta  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Propuesta esta formado por 7 mujeres trabajadoras que son vecinas y amigas, viven todas por la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, lugar que tiene extensas llanuras propicias para la cría de ganado, su clima es frió. Su gente se caracteriza porque aun mantienen viva la llama de sus tradiciones y cultura, su gastronomía es típica del sector, Las socias  aun mantienen como herencia de sus padres estas tradiciones y lo llevan muy orgullosas en sus vestimentas, además son personas alegres, amables y carismáticas que con su trabajo diario mejoran la economía de sus hogares para sacar adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Olga, se encuentra en su seguro crédito que realiza en el banco comunal La Propuesta, es una mujer casada que tiene 29 años de edad y ha concebido 3 hijo de 9, 7 y 5 años de edad, todos sus hijos están estudiando en un escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo trabaja en la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres de manera independiente.

La Señora. Olga tiene terrenos en los cuales se dedica a la ganadería y la venta de leche, también cría pollos y cerdos a los que los vende en su comunidad, siembra varios productos y las cosechas que realiza son para el consumo de su hogar. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a tejer chompas y gorras de lana en especial para sus hijos o si alguna amiga o vecina le pide lo realiza, esta actividad la aprendió por habilidad.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  pollos para crecer en este negocio y también en alimento para todos sus animales. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia para vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
The 'La Propuesta' community bank has 7 hard-working female members who are all friends and neighbors.  They live in Victoria del Portete parish in Cuenca.  This area has vast plains which are ideal for raising livestock.  The climate is cold.  The local people are known for keeping alive the flame of their traditions and culture.  The local cuisine is typical of the area.  The members of this group maintain these traditions and are very proud to keep them.  They are friendly, cheerful, charming people who work daily to improve their household finances and provide for their families.

One of the members of this group is Olga who is requesting her second loan through the La Propuesta community bank.  She is a 29-year-old married woman who has three children aged 9, 7 and 5.  Her children are all attending a school in the town.  Her husband works in construction as a builder.  They do not own their own home but live independently in her parents' house.

Olga has land where she raises cattle and sells milk.  She also raises chickens and pigs which she sells in her community.  She grows crops for her own family's consumption.  In her free time, Olga knits sweaters and hats, especially for her children or for a friend or neighbor who might ask her.  She learned this activity through practice.

Olga will invest her loan in buying chickens so that she can grow in her business.  She will also buy feed for all her animals.  Her dream is to own her own home where she can live with her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Ana, soltera con 2 hijos, ella se dedica  a la publicidad y promoción para una empresa privada, actividad que desarrolla hace algún tiempo y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Ana está solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en la educación de sus  hijos que estan en colegio particular, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo directo de su esposo, todo sacrificio es íntegramente para sus 2 menores hijos;  por ello La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con su familia. Ana pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member’s name is Ana. She is single and she has two children. She works as a publicist for a private business. She has done this for some time and the work has allowed her move her family forward. 
Ana is requesting a loan to invest in the educations of her children. Her children attend private school and she does not receive direct support from her husband. All of the sacrifices are entirely for her two young children. The member is very grateful to Kiva for supporting her family. She belongs to the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: pay for the education of her children

loans.name: Yadman

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Yadman, Soltero con 26 años de edad, él se dedica al cambio de moneda nacional y extranjera, en un modulo ubicado en un centro comercial de la ciudad, el cual le sirve como casa de cambio, y que le ha permitido mantenerse y ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar. Yadman está solicitando el préstamo para inyectar de capital efectivo a su actividad.
Yadman está  ahorrando para adquirir una tienda, que le proporcione más comodidad y que también le permita vender artesanías y suvenires, esto para ampliar y mejorar su actividad y mejorar sus ingresos.
Yadman está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica. El pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Yadman is 26 years old, single, and his business is changing currency (both national and international).  He has a unit in a shopping mall in the city which he uses for his bureau de change.  This business has allowed him to support himself and help his parents with their household expenses.  Yadman is requesting this loan so that he can inject cash into his business.

Yadman is saving up to acquire a store which would provide him with more comfort and would also allow him to sell handicrafts and souvenirs.  This would enable him to expand and improve his business, and improve his income.

Yadman is very grateful to Kiva for helping him with his business.  He belongs to the 'Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II' community bank which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to inject cash into his bureau de change

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA LUCIA,  TIENE 46  AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA VIVEN EN LA COMUNIDAD DE BUENA VISTA DE LA  PROVINCIA  MIZQUE DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA,   LLEVA UNA VIDA SOLITARIA  YA QUE SUS HIJOS SON MAYORES, COLABORAN EN LA PRODUCCIÓN SEGÚN SUS POSIBILIDADES. POR LAS HELADAS FUERTES  REGISTRADAS EN FECHAS DEL 15 AL 25 DE JULIO DEL PRESENTE AÑO EN LA ZONA, DOÑA LUCIA HA PERDIDO EL 50% DE SU PRODUCCIÓN DE TOMATE Y PAPA EL CUAL A OCASIONANDO UNA DISMINUCIÓN DE INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS POR VENTA, DE ESTOS PRODUCTOS, ES POR ESTOS MOTIVOS MENCIONADOS LA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA HA SUFRIDO UN DESEQUILIBRIO AFECTANDO DIRECTAMENTE EN LA ADQUISICIÓN DE LOS MATERIALES E INSUMOS REQUERIDOS PARA LA PRODUCCIÓN COMO EN LA CANASTA FAMILIAR PARA LA ALIMENTACIÓN DE LOS JORNALEROS QUE EMPLEA. ELLA NECESITA COMPRAR INSUMOS AGRÍCOLAS Y SEMILLAS PARA VOLVER A EMPEZAR Y ASÍ MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA Y RETOMAR EL CAMINO DE LA PROSPERIDAD. TAMBIÉN INDICA QUE SIEMPRE COMPLEMENTA SUS REQUERIMIENTOS ECONÓMICOS TRABAJANDO COMO PEÓN EN LA COSECHA DE VERDURAS EN LA ZONA.
texts.en: Lucia is 46 years old, single, and lives in Buena Vista community, in Mizque province, in Cochabamba department.  She leads a solitary life as her children are already grown up, though they help her out when they can.  Owing to the severe frosts which were experienced in her area between July 15th and July 25th this year, Lucia lost 50% of her tomato and potato crops.  This led to a decrease in her income at sale time.  For this reason, her financial stability has been thrown off balance, which has directly affected her ability to acquire both the materials and supplies she needs for her farming as well as the basic groceries she needs to feed the laborers that she employs.  Lucia needs to buy farm supplies and seeds so that she can start again, improve her quality of life and re-join the path to prosperity.  She tells us that she meets her financial needs by additionally working as a laborer in her area at harvest time.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and seeds

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Victoria, 32 años de edad, casada  y con 2 hijos, ella se dedica  a brindar servicios de masajes en un SPA de la ciudad, actividad que va principalmente dirigida al mercado turístico y que desarrolla hace algún tiempo, el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia.
Victoria está solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en otra actividad paralela que ella está concretando, que es la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, como cuyes y gallinas que tienen buena demanda en el medio;  por ello La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con su familia y a expandir sus horizontes. Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Victoria is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  Her business is providing massage services in a spa in the city.  These services are aimed mainly at the tourist market and she has been in this line of work for some time.  It has allowed her to provide for her family.

Victoria is requesting this loan to invest in another business that she is setting up, raising and selling animals such as guinea pigs and hens for which there is good demand.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to support her family and expand her horizons.  Victoria belongs to the 'Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II' community bank which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy hens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia prepara pollo al horno,saltado de carne y sopas,la socia atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica al negocio de restaurant 10 años y le va muy bien por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,verduras y pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member works in a restaurant. She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She makes baked chicken, stir-fried beef and soups. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. The member has worked at the restaurant for 10 years and the business is going very well. The member wants to move ahead and wants her children to finish their studies. Her dream is to expand her restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase meat, vegetables and chicken.
The member is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase meat, vegetables and chickens.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es:
Diana, de 23 años, es una mujer amable, solidaria y muy responsable, está soltera y no tiene hijos, trabaja a diario para mejorar su nivel de vida, vive en casa de su madre en donde comparte junto a ella y sus hermanos el mismo deseo por salir adelante y progresar. El trabajo de Diana consiste en la venta de comida, jugos y desayunos. Trabaja en su casa en donde instala a diario un par de mesas con sus respectivas sillas y una mesa principal en done prepara todos los jugos que pone a la venta elaborados de frutas frescas y saludables. Los desayunos que ofrece son hechos a base de pan, huevos, quesos, jamonadas y pollo, además ofrece tamales y juanes. Lleva en este negocio más de 3 años, trabaja con la ayuda de su mamá y juntas se encargan de deleitar a sus clientes con los mejores sabores.  Como toda mujer con ganas de superarse tiene muchos objetivos pero el principal por ahora es el de consolidarse con su negocio de comidas, para ello desea ambientar e implementar un espacio de mayor amplitud dentro de su casa para poder realizar su trabajo con mayor tranquilidad y calidad. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000), comprará frutas, ingredientes, insumos y materiales para continuar realizando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Diana is 23 years old and is a friendly, caring and responsible woman. She is single and has no children.  She works day by day to improve her quality of life. She lives in her mother's house which she also shares with her siblings. They all share the same desire to improve and get ahead. 

Diana works selling food, juice and breakfasts. She works in her house where every day she sets up a tables and chairs and a main table where she prepares the healthy fresh fruit juices she makes and sells. The breakfasts she makes are based on bread, eggs, cheese, ham and chicken and she also sells tamales and juanes (leaves from the bihao plant stuffed with rice and spices). She has had this business for over 3 years. She works with the help of her mother and together they work to please their customers with the best delicious flavours. 

Like any woman who wants to improve, she has many goals but the main one for now is to get her food business together. For this she hopes to make a large space within her house where she can carry out her work peacefully and provide a better-quality service. 

This is her third credit with MFP, and she is grateful to all the people who have made the loan possible so that she can continue to carry out her work with better results. On the other hand she promises to make her repayments punctually as she did with her previous loans. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because the members are responsible and very caring. With the amount she is asking for of 1000 sol she will buy fruits, ingredients, supplies and materials to continue carrying out his work.

loans.use: to buy fruits and ingredients.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es: EL SEÑORA ZACARIAS,  TIENE 44  AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERO VIVEN EN LA COMUNIDAD DE QUEBRADAS DE LA  PROVINCIA  MIZQUE DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA,   LLEVA UNA VIDA SOLITARIA  YA QUE NO TIENE HIJOS COMPARTE SU VIDA CON LOS PARIENTES MAS CERCANOS COMO SER SU HERMANA Y SOBRINOS, QUE LOS COLABORAN EN LA PRODUCCIÓN SEGÚN SUS POSIBILIDADES. POR LAS HELADAS FUERTES  REGISTRADAS EN FECHAS DEL 15 AL 25 DE JULIO DEL PRESENTE AÑO EN LA ZONA, DON ZACARIAS HA PERDIDO MAS DEL 50% DE SU PRODUCCIÓN DE CAMOTE Y PAPA EL CUAL A OCASIONANDO UNA DISMINUCIÓN DE INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS POR VENTA, DE ESTOS PRODUCTOS, ES POR ESTOS MOTIVOS MENCIONADOS LA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA HA SUFRIDO UN DESEQUILIBRIO AFECTANDO DIRECTAMENTE EN LA ADQUISICIÓN DE LOS MATERIALES E INSUMOS REQUERIDOS PARA LA PRODUCCIÓN COMO EN LA CANASTA FAMILIAR PARA LA ALIMENTACIÓN DE LOS JORNALEROS QUE EMPLEA. EL SEÑOR ZACARIAS NECESITA COMPRAR INSUMOS AGRÍCOLAS Y SEMILLAS CON EL OBJETIVO DE MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA Y RETOMAR EL CAMINO DE LA PROSPERIDAD. TAMBIÉN INDICA QUE SIEMPRE COMPLEMENTA SUS REQUERIMIENTOS ECONÓMICOS TRABAJANDO Y ALQUILANDO SUS BUEYES PARA EL ARADO DE LA TIERRA EN LA ZONA.
texts.en:
Zacarias is 44 years old, single, and lives in Quebradas community, in Mizque province, in Cochabamba department.  He leads a solitary life as he doesn't have any children.  He shares his life with his closest relatives: his sister and her children.  They help him out when they can.

As a result of the severe frosts which occurred in his region between July 15th and July 25th this year, Zacarias lost 50% of his potato and sweet potato crops which led to a decrease in his income at sale time.  His financial stability has been thrown off balance and this has directly affected his ability to acquire the materials and supplies he needs for his crops, as well as the groceries he needs to feed the laborers that he employs.

Zacarias needs to buy farm supplies and seeds so that he can start again, improve his quality of life and re-join the path to prosperity. He tells us that he meets his financial needs by additionally working with and hiring out his oxen to plow other people's land.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and seeds

loans.name: Sophary's Group

texts.en: As a young 26-year-old mother with two schoolchildren, Sophary and her husband are providing for their family by using a half-hectare of farm for rice cropping. For seven years, she has been with this business. She can earn about 14,000 KHR per day. Sophary's group consists of three female members, and she is the group leader. All of the members in her group have been with VisionFund for at least one cycle; Sophary is a fourth-time borrower, another group member is a second-time borrower, and the remaining group member is a third-time borrower. After the successful repayment of her past loans, she can manage to buy a decent motorbike for her family as well as to fix her house. For this cycle, she formed this new group to seek a loan. Sophary, as a group leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs for plowing her farm. She hopes to plant her cash-crops on time so as to maintain her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs for plowing her farm

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ream's Group

texts.en:
Aged 39, Ream is an inhabitant from Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap province. She has six children in total, but only four are living with her as some of them are still in school, while the remaining are working for others for a fee with a low salary.

She has tackled her family's hardship via a minimal income received from working as a paid quarry worker. Her husband also helps to increase their income via buying cows for resale. 

Ream and another two members are joining in the same group; all of them are the first-time borrowers seeking the same loan amount of 200,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) each. As a group leader, Ream will use her portion to buy two piglets for raising as an extra income source. She hopes to raise her pigs healthily and sell them with a high price so she can upgrade her living conditions better than before.

loans.use: To buy two piglets for raising as extra income.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Arber

texts.en:
Arber, a bright and a hardworking young man who is passionate about animals, is a member of the minority community of Macedonians. He has been active in livestock for four years in his rural home of Southeastern Albania, across the borders from Macedonia, where he currently lives with his parents. He is aged 24, engaged and planning to get married soon. Arber has been selling dairy products to the local dairy farms.

Arber has requested a loan of 200,000 Albania Leke (ALL) from VisionFund Albania to buy a milk cow; the baby calves he has are all males. This is his second loan. He used the previous loan from the same institution that is paid off now to start up his livestock business. Arber wants to grow the business and his plans are to employ others to assist him with it. The terrain where he resides is just perfect for this type of activity, and he is confident that he will succeed at it. 

Arber seeks appreciation from lenders.

loans.use: To add one more milk cow to the existing one.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna, a citizen from Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap province, is 50 years old and married. In a house that consists of eight children, she needs to cater for only two children who are still in school. 

Rice cultivation on a 1.5 hectare area is her main source of family income. She has farmed rice for 10 years and is able to earn about 29,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. To add up more income, she also runs a small grocery stall. 

With VisionFund, she and her group consisting of four members are in their first loan cycle. All of them, including Vanna, are applying for the same loan amount of 200,000 KHR each. Vanna, who is a group leader, will use her loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale, including shampoo, food ingredients, instant noodles, canned food, etc. She hopes this purchase will enable her to replenish her grocery items on time for reselling. By doing so, she can earn more profit in order to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To replenish her grocery items on time for reselling.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Edrion

texts.en:
Edrion is 33 years, married with two little children and is the sole financial provider for their family that lives in Southeastern Albania. He works for pay at a local bakery as a bread maker and also owns some agricultural land where Edrion has planted plum orchards and grapevines. 

He earns an income by selling fruits, whether plums or grapes, to store owners for sale and locals for the homemade delicious traditional drink production of “raki”. He has done this since 2001. 

Edrion is requesting a Kiva loan now, which he will use to buy organic products for preventing and destroying any pests in his plum orchards. This loan will allow him to increase plum production and income, and to set aside some savings for their family.

loans.use: to buy organic products for preventing and destroying pests

loans.name: Piseth's Group

texts.en:
In a household consisting of four children, Piseth is one of the breadwinners of the family. The entire family is originally from Sa Ang district of Kandal Province. He and his wife have sustained his family via growing mangos and bananas. For 23 years with this business, he can earn about 16,000 KHR per day.

Regarding this business, the main challenges are the declining price of the cash-crop and the lack of working capital for supporting his business. Piseth's group is composed of two members and both of them have joined VisionFund for at least 3 loan cycles. Now they are in their fourth loan cycle with Kiva's partner VisionFund and Piseth is a group leader. His past loan has been repaid back with success and it has enabled him to support his business on time and improve his family's livelihood.

For this new loan cycle, he is seeking 800,000 KHR while his co-member (female) is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As a group leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his mango and banana trees. He expects this purchase will reduce the damage from pests and boost the production so he can earn more income and strengthening his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his mango and banana trees

loans.name: Fatiko

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 young children, Fatiko, a 24-year-old, works very hard to support her family, who currently stand below the poverty level. She plants veggies and crops in her garden and sells cow milk to locals; this income she makes from dairy is the only one for her family. Fatiko is borrowing 50,000 LEK through VisionFund Albania to buy another milk cow to increase the milk production, since she has a clientele already.

With the previous loan from the same institution, she purchased the cows she has at the moment. This loan has been repaid.

Fatiko has been sustaining her business activities through the past six years and has been content with the activity and income. She hopes that her hard work and income will help her attain her dream to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one more milk cow

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Aged 37 years, Savy is married with six children, five of whom are dependent on her. Her family lives in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is a rice farmer who grows rice on one-hectare of farmland to support the family. Having been in this business for fifteen years, she can earn approximately 24,000KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day for future needs. 

Savy’s group consists of three members who live in the same village, and she is a first-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to purchase wire for electrical connection purposes and to cover the labor cost for this connection. She hopes this loan will enable her to have electricity for her family.

loans.use: To buy electric wire for electrical connections to her house.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Lyheang

texts.en:
Lyheang is a 38-year-old widower and a father with one child. He lives in a rural area of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. As a widower, he has struggled to make a living through growing cabbages for ten years and also complementing the income by buying and selling cows. The current business earns him around US$11 per day and allows him to save about US$4 each day after deducting daily expenses.

Lyheang is a first cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is applying for a loan with VisionFund of US$500. With this loan, he is going to buy more cows to resell. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his income from his business so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more cows to resell.

loans.name: Chamroen

texts.en:
Chamroen is age 34 years and married. She has two children, both of whom are living with her. One is still in school while the other one works as a tailor to help the family generate extra income. Chamroen has been in rice farming for five years and complementing the income by work as a tailor while her husband is a paid construction worker. The current business earns her family around US$9 a day and they manage to save about US$5. 

Chamroen has been with VisonFund for three cycles and all these past loans have been repaid back already. The previous loans have helped her relieve the family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is requesting a loan of US$400. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to pay for labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Poy's Group

texts.en:
Poy, 40 years old and a rural farmer, lives in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province (Cambodia).  She is married with two children who are dependent on her and help with the family business. She has grown corn on a 4-hectare area of farmland for 11 years to support the family. From the current business, she is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day and 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy field. 

Poy has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the past loan while the other member is just with VisionFund for this loan cycle. She has wisely used the first loan to better support her family with sufficient food. Now leading her group of two to ask for a loan, Poy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her corn more fruitfully and healthfully so as to keep her lifestyle in a good condition.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her plantation

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Originally from a rural area of the Kandal province’s Kandal Steong district of Cambodia, Sophal is age 38 and he is a married father of one son who is dependent on him and still in school. To support the family, Sophal has been involved in rice farming for ten years and working as a paid construction worker in the local area, while his wife is a tailor to supplement the family’s income. He and his wife are able to earn about US$11 per day and save US$6 each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Sophal received his first micro-loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago. The past loan has helped him to build a proper kitchen for cooking and eating for his family. Now he is seeking a loan of US$700. With this loan, he is going to buy cows for raising and also help the family in the rice paddy business. He hopes this loan will enable him to have more calves so as to make a better living for his family and keep his child in school.

loans.use: To buy cows for raising and also help the family in the rice paddy business.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Age 48 years, Sarom is married with eight children, three of whom are dependent on her. She lives in a rural area of the Kandal Steong district of Kandal province. The main source of the family’s income for eight years is from rice farming, and selling eggs complements the income. She is able to earn around 30,000KHR per day and manages to save about 20,000KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is the first-time loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for Sarom’s group who are both females. She is leading her group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund of 600,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to spend on labor. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice timely and healthfully so as to sell it for a good price and build on her savings for renovating her old house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en:
Nang, a married mother of five children, lives in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province.

To support the daily basic needs, she has managed her three hectares of farmland for planting paddy rice. The business, which she has been with for 10 years, has helped her to earn about 9,000 KHR per day. Five loan cycles ago she took her original loan from Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She has succeeded in using the past loan in a smart manner in order to relieve her family's burden and return back a decent lifestyle. 

In order to keep up this good living and support her business on time, she has formed a group of three female members to apply for a new loan. She and one of her co-members are sixth-time borrowers, while another member is a fourth-time borrower. Each of them is seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR. 

As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that this purchase will multiply her production so she can make more income to sustain her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Aged 32, Mom is a farmer from Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She has two children; one is in school but another one is still too young. 

She manages 2 hectares of farmland for cultivating rice, while her husband does cow and buffalo trading (buying and reselling). She has been with this business for 14 years. 

Mom has never been with VisionFund before. She formed a group of three female members for the new loan; all of them are requesting the same loan amount of 3,000,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) each. As a group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for water pumping plus transplanting her crop. Moreover, she will use some portion of it to buy cows and buffalo for supporting her husband's business. She strongly believes that she will receive a high productivity from her cash-crop, thereby, she can enlarge her income and expand her business gradually.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pay for water pumping plus transplant her crop.

loans.name: Kheang's Group

texts.en:
Kheang is 45 years old and living in a rural area of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He has two children, one of whom is dependent on him and still in school. To make a living, he has been planting cabbages and beans for twenty-five years. He is able to earn about 20,000KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. The low price paid for his crop yield is still the main challenge.

Kheang has been with VisionFund for one cycle and he has completely paid back the past loan that helped him to relieve his family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now leading his group of three members to ask for a loan, Kheang, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes his crop will become more productive and profitable so as to expand his business in order to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland.

loans.name: Saroem's Group

texts.en:
Saroem, 52, is a villager residing in a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is divorced and has four children, one of whom is still in school. This single mother, Saroem, feeds her family through cultivating corn on three hectares of farmland. She has been involved in this business for 17 years, earning approximately 20,000KHR per day, and after deducting her daily expenses, she has only 5,000KHR left for her savings.

Due to the lack of working capital, Saroem and her group member, Nget, have decided to seek a loan in the amount of 1,000,000KHR each. The loan portion for Saroem will be spent on buying fertilizers, pesticides, and corn seed. For this first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, Saroem hopes greatly that her corn field will provide her with better and higher yields so that she can improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and corn seed.

loans.name: Saam's Group

texts.en:
SaAm is originally from the Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia. She has three children, two of whom are dependent on her and too young to attend school.

To sustain her household, she grows pigs at home and her husband does rice-cropping on one hectare of farmland. She has been in this business for six years and she is able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day. 

There are three members in SaAm's group. She is in the fifth loan cycle while the other two co-members are newly joined clients with Kiva's partner (VisionFund). She has managed her past fours loans wisely in order to improve her living conditions. 

For this cycle, she wants to expand her pig-raising business. She leads this group to request a new loan. For her loan portion, she is going to buy more piglets and feed and build a pigpen. She hopes to raise her pig healthily so as to sell it for a high price in order to keep supporting her family, especially her children.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and feed and to build a pigpen.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two children who are in school, Chan is 30 years old, residing in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province.

She has two and a half hectares of rice cultivation farmland in order to support her daily basic needs. She has engaged in this business for 10 years. 

This is her fourth time with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She has had success in improving her living conditions and keeping her children in school, and she also has managed to pay back the entire loan. 

Now, she is in a group of two. Her co-member is male and a second-time borrower with VisionFund. The total loan amount of her group is 2,600,000 KHR. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR and her co-member is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. 

As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide for her crop. She hopes to receive a double yield so she can have more profit in order to maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Lorm's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia, Lorm is a 55-year-old married woman with five children. Among her children who live at home, one is still in school while another one works as a paid worker. Lorm and her husband earn their living through farming rice. Lorm has 30 years of experience in this business, earning around 23,000KHR per day.

She is a second-cycle client with VisionFund and is now leading a group member, who also is a second-cycle client with VisionFund, to apply for a loan in the amount of 400,000KHR in total. The past loans have helped Lorm guarantee the food security for her family and cover her household expenses. With this new requested loan portion, which is 100,000KHR, Lorm will buy fertilizers to apply in her rice-farming business. Via the help of this new portion of loan, Lorm believes that she can produce a higher income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sarin, aged 25, resides in a rural area of the Sangke district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and has two dependent children, one daughter and one son. She has been feeding her family through a rice-farming business for ten years, enabling her to earn around 12,000KHR each day. To supplement the income, Sarin’s husband works for others for a fee.

Sarin is a second cycle client with VisionFund and now, accompanied by her group members who are first cycle clients with VisionFund, is seeking a loan in the amount of 100,000KHR each. The past loans have enabled Sarin to better feed her family and strengthen her rice-farming business. With the new loan portion, she will buy fertilizers to apply in her rice field as well as to cover the fees of plowing the field. In the future, she hopes to see improvement in her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en:
A resident in a rural area of Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Cambodia, Mean is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. One of her children is still dependent on her while the other three work as fishermen. To earn the living for the family, Mean and her husband are working as fishermen. The current business that she has been doing for 25 years enables her each day to earn approximately 25,000KHR. 

She has received loans via VisionFund four times, with which she has succeeded in meeting the family’s needs. She is now leading a group of two (her fellow group member is male) to request a new loan in the amount of 500,000KHR each. With the new requested loan portion, she will purchase a cast net to support her fish-catching business. After receiving this new loan portion, Mean hopes that the living conditions of her family will be much better than before.

loans.use: To purchase a cast net to support her fish-catching business.

loans.name: Saade's Group

texts.en:
Saade is a 43-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Saade is one of the many Iraqi women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Saade has three years' experience with a small, home-based sewing and tailoring business, which she would now like to improve by replacing her old sewing machine with a new one and also by buying an overlock machine (for decorative stitching). With these purchases she will be able to offer more choices to her customers and provide them with more creative options. To be able to buy the machines, she took a loan from Relief International-Microfinance Iraq.  

Relief International-Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor and therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine and to buy an overlock machine.

loans.name: Roery's Group

texts.en:
Roery, 29, is a mother of one son. Her family is living in a rural area of Ratanak Mondul district, Cambodia.

To earn a living, she and her husband have been growing red corn on their three hectares of farmland for six years, from which she is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day. However, her production seems to be declining due to the pests that destroyed her crop.

To overcome this challenge, she has formed a group consisting of three female members to seek a new loan. Each of them is seeking the same loan amount of 800,000 KHR. As the group leader, Roery will use her portion to buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide for her paddy. She highly hopes that this purchase will help her to fight the pests that harm her cash crop and return back a good yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide for her paddy.

loans.name: Sal's Group

texts.en:
As a mother of three children who are too young for schooling, Sal needs to maintain her household via growing rice on her three hectares of farmland and planting pineapple on a half-hectare area. She has been with this business for 12 years.

As her crop depends mainly on rainfall, sometimes she has received only minimal harvest when there is not enough rain. Sal's past loan with Vision Fund (Kiva's partner) was the first loan, which has supported her business and which she has paid back already.

Now she is in a group of four members. She and one of her fellow group members are in second-cycle loans, requesting 1,200,000 KHR each, while the other two borrowers are in first-cycle loans, applying for 1,000,000 KHR each.

As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She truly believes that she will receive a higher yield  than before and earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Hathaka's Group

texts.en:
Hathaka is a rural villager from the Muong Russey district of Cambodia. In her household, there are eight members including her six children: four daughters and two sons. 

The five hectares of rice-growing farmland and two hectares of corn-planting, which she has worked for 10 years, has provided a decent income of about 21,000 KHR per day for her family.

This is the second loan cycle for Hathaka, the same as the remaining members in her group, which consists of four female members including her. The first loan, which she has paid back, helped her to support her business in a timely way. 

Now, she is a leader in her group. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that this purchase will boost her crop's productivity more than before, so she can get a high income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Poeurn's Group

texts.en:
Poeurn is a 40-year-old farmer who does rice farming on three hactares of farmland and has one hectare of pineapple-planting farmland. The income from both crops is mainly used for supporting her household, especially her four children who are still young. (She has five children in total.) She has engaged in this business for 20 years. 

Poeurn, a second-time borrower, has joined a microloan group with a new client who is a first-time borrower with Kiva's partner (VisionFund). 

The first loan enabled Poeurn to improve her standard of living. Within this cycle, she is seeking 600,000 KHR, while her co-member is applying for 500,000 KHR. 

As group leader, Poeurn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for both of her crops. She hopes to grow her rice and pineapple well and sell them for a high price in order to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Yum's Group

texts.en:
A mother of one schoolchild and one young child living in the Kror Kor district of Cambodia, Yum has struggled on her farmland, which consists of a one-and-a-half hectare rice field. In this business for 14 years, she is able to earn about 24,000 KHR per day. In addition to helping on the rice field, her husband uses his spare time buying rice, chicken, and fish for resale.

Yom's group consists of four female members, all second-cycle clients each requesting 1,000,000 KHR from VisionFund. As the group leader, Yom is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her crop and more chickens for resale. She expects to achieve high production and sell a lot of chickens as she strives to make more income for her children's sake.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop and more chickens.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal, a 32-year-old mother of six children, is a hardworking farmer originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Cambodia. 

For ten years, she has been managing her three hectares of farmland for growing rice and two hectares of farmland for growing pepper, which helps her to earn about 21,000 KHR per day. 

Her past loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) was a first-cycle loan; she has paid back the entire loan and has solved the need for growing her crops on time. 

She now forms a group of two members, both women and in the second-cycle. However, they are seeking different loan amounts; 500,000 KHR is Sophal's requested amount, while 1,000,000 KHR is her co-member's requested amount. 

For Sophal, as a group leader, she will use this entire portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gain more yield so she can save some money to build a new decent house for her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal is a rural villager residing in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. In total, she is blessed with eight children, but only seven of them are living with her. Three are students while the remaining four are the paid factory workers with low salaries.

To make a living, she and her husband do rice cultivation on a two-hectare area of farmland. She has been involved in this business for 27 years. However, she sometimes encounters a poor crop caused by shortage of water.

Phal has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for one cycle. She has smartly used her first loan with success to keep up a good progress for her business as well as her family. 

She is not only a breadwinner in her big family but also a leader in her big group microloan, which consists of 10 members seeking a new loan. Eight members of her group, including Phal, are second-cycle loan clients, while the remaining two just joined VisionFund this cycle. 

Phal's loan portion will be used to pay for harrowing fees and transplanting fees and to buy four sacks of fertilizer for her rice field. She has high hopes that she will receive triple production so she can keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To pay for harrowing and transplanting fees and to buy four sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
A young 24-year-old mother of one daughter, Rin has coped with her family financial difficulty via growing paddy rice on her 2-hectare area and raising 4 pigs at home. Her husband not only helps her on both business, but also produces rice wine for sale as additional income. 

Rin has never been with VisionFund before. She is applying for her first-cycle in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. Rin is a leader in her group consisting of two female members- her fellow group member is a fourth-time borrower and seeking 1,000,000 KHR. For Rin loan's portion, she is going to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as she can upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak is an original citizen from Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She is married and has two children who are still in school. For her kid's sake, Sopheak grows rice, sells grocery items, and raises pigs. Her husband also helps to generate additional income via running a tiny barber shop in the area and growing vegetables. Sopheak can earn about 28,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has been with for 10 years. 

Sopheak is a loyal client who has been with VisionFund for ages, past six loan cycles. The past loans have gradually helped Sopheak until she established many businesses with a decent income, as mentioned above. Now, she is applying for her seventh-cycle loan. She is going to use this portion to buy a decent motorbike for supporting her business. Also, she will use a portion of it to buy more grocery items such as canned food, non-perishable food, instant noodles, etc. for resale. She hopes that this purchase will help her to reduce the expenses related to transportation and return her a good income.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and grocery items

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.ru:
Махсуда проживает в городе Истаравшан. Она замужем. Ей 30 лет. У нее трое детей. Муж Махсуды занимается строительными работами в санаториях. 
Махсуда занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Махсуда закупает крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Она берет кредит для закупа крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Makhsuda lives in the city of Istaravshan. She is 30 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband does construction work in health spas. For the past 5 years, Makhsuda has been involved in animal husbandry. She buys cattle for future re-sale. Makhsuda is now seeking a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Hugo, casado y con 2 hijos, él se dedica al servicio de taxi, actividad que realiza para ayudar a su esposa quien vende comida.  Hugo está solicitando el préstamo para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo y de paso pagar los estudios de sus hijos, uno de ellos estudiante universitario y el otro en una academia pre universitaria
Hugo está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica. El pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Our member, Hugo, and his wife have 2 children.  He has a taxi business, his wife has a food sales business and their combined income goes to supporting their family.  Hugo is applying for a loan that he will use to pay vehicle maintenance costs and school fees.  His oldest child is in college and his youngest is studying at a pre-college academy.  
Hugo says that he is grateful to KIVA lenders for supporting his business.  He is a member of the Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II community bank in the Peruvian city of Cusco.

loans.use: to pay vehicle maintenance costs and school fees.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de bazar, el socio vende regalos y peluches, el socio también se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesanía como sombreros, pantalones y mantas, el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía y venta de negocio de bazar. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar regalos y peluches y también para que compre artesanía como sombreros, mantas y pantalones al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Adrian continues working in his variety store. He sells gifts and stuffed animals. He also still works selling hand made items such as hats, pants, and sweaters. He has been in this business for eight years. These businesses are how he moves his children forward. His dreams is to grow his handicraft and variety shop business. He is applying for the loan to buy gifts and stuffed animals, as well as handicrafts such as hats, blankets, and pants wholesale. He is happy for the loan and promised to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy gifts and stuffed animals, as well as handicrafts like hats, blankets, and pants wholesale.

loans.name: Nhors

texts.en:
Nhors is 51 years old, married, and has four children. The rest of her family is living in a rural village from Kror Kor district of Pursat province. Rice-farming is the main source of income for her family. During the spare time, she and her husband work for others for a fee for extra income. Having been with this business for 15 years, she is able to earn almost 17,000 KHR per day. 

Nhors took her first loan with VisonFund two cycles ago. She has succeeded in using the past two loans to timely support her rice-growing business. In order to maintain her production, she is applying for the third-cycle loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay for transplanting fee plus plowing fee. With a portion of the loan, Nhors will buy a small plot of land in the village. She truly believes that she will receive a good yield and a good plot of land nearby the road, as it is the potential location for running a new business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for transplanting and plowing fees

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en:
Kanha, a young mother of one son, is an inhabitant from Bakan district of Pursat Province, Cambodia. Her family source of income is from her two hectares of rice-cropping farmland, while the secondary source of income is from a motorbike washing service in the area. The current businesses earn her about 23,000 KHR per day. 

This is Kanha's first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She is seeking 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and use a portion of it to buy a washing machine. She hopes to earn more income so as she can improve her living condition better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm and use a portion of it to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Manuel Concepcion

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,el socio prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,el socio junto con su esposa sacan adelante este negocio,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.El socio solicita el credito para implementar su restaurant para comprar sillas,mesas y utensilios de cocina como ollas,sarten y tazas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Manuel continues to work in his restaurant. He prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Together with his wife, they move this business forward. Manuel works from 8 in the morning to 9 at night. This business is how he moves his children forward. His dream is to be able to expand his restaurant. He is asking for the loan to outfit his restaurant to buy chairs, tables, and kitchen utensils like pots, pans, and cups. He is happy for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to outfit his restaurant to buy chairs, tables, and kitchen utensils like pots, pans, and cups.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath, age 62, is married and a rural villager from Kror Kor district, Cambodia. She has four children in total, but only one son is under her responsibility as he is a student. To sustain her household, Sambath grows paddy rice and raises pigs while her husband helps with the rice farm and provides his threshing service for a fee. Sambath can earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the current business which she has been with for 12 years.

This is her fourth microloan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The past loan, which she has paid back, has gradually provided support to her business with a decent income. For this cycle, she is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while her co-member is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. As a group leader, Sambath is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cash-crop and pig's feed for her pig-raising business. She highly hopes that she can double her income from both businesses so she can keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash-crop and pig's feed for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea is a mother of six children, one of whom is still in school. The rest of her family lives in a thatched house located in the Kror Kor district of Cambodia where rice farming is common among the villagers as the main source of income. Like others in her neighborhood, Kea also does rice farming on three hectares of land and she raises pigs at home. With 34 years of experiences in her current business, she is able to earn about 22,000 KHR per day. 

Kea has had one previous loan with VisionFund. Having successfully paid back that loan, she feels confident that she can maintain good conditions for her business and family. Now, she is in a group of two female members. She and her co-member are applying for 1,2000,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. Kea is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field and to purchase pig feed. She hopes that she will become a successful farmer who has a high yield and makes a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Sotheary's Group

texts.en:
Sotheary, a mother of two children, is 28 years old and a citizen from Kandieng district of  Pursat Province,Cambodia. To cover her basic daily needs, she has managed her two and half hectare of farmland for growing rice as her core business. Her husband also helps her to earn extra income by running a small stall for battery charging, grinding rice, and raising pigs. Sotheary has been involved in this business for eight years and is able to earn about 17,000 KHR per day. 

Sotheary's group consists of three members. Sotheary is a fourth-time borrower while her two fellow group member are the third-time borrowers. She has maintained her business well since her first loan, which she has fully paid back. As group leader, Sotheary is going to use her portion of this new loan to buy fertilizer for her crops and to buy pig feed. She hopes to have more income so as she can obtain a good standard of living for her household.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Petr

texts.ru:
Петр  - фермер. С 2009 года занимается выращиванием редиски и помидора.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает жена, есть  двое маленьких детей, 7-ми и 2-х лет. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания ранней редиски и помидора в теплицах расположенных на 10 сотках земли.
Петр решил приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплиц, в которых он выращивает редиску и  помидоры.
В планах на будущие:  построить несколько новых теплиц, также приобрести косилку и мотоблок для обработки своего земельного участка.
В личных планах: покупка микроавтобуса для транспортировки товара на рынок сбыта, также достроить гараж.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки для теплицы.
texts.en:
Petr is a farmer. Since 2009, he has been growing radishes and tomatoes. His wife helps him with the farm work, and they have two small children, aged 7 and 2 years old. 

Petr began his business by raising early radishes and tomatoes in greenhouses on a 1,000 square meter plot of land. He has decided to buy a covering for the greenhouses where he grows his produce. In the future, Petr plans to construct several new greenhouses, and to buy a mower and small tractor to work his land. He also plans to buy a mini-bus to transport his goods to the market, and to build a garage. 

Petr needs your assistance to finance the purchase of a covering for his greenhouses.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda, de 65 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, además de ser amable y de un trato cordial.  Es conviviente con Félix quien se dedica a la agricultura y es padre de sus 6 hijos. Vive en compañía de su pareja y 2 de sus hijos Freddy de 37 años  y Carlos de 19 años de edad ya que lo demás son independientes, habita  en una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Florinda es la venta de plátanos para lo cual a acondicionado una mesa en el frontis de su casa y atiende a sus clientes, siendo en su mayoría sus propios vecinos a lo que atiende de manera cordial y amena llegando a ganarse su respeto y cariño. Lleva dedicándose a ésta actividad hace más de 4 años, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos quienes le apoyan en la compra del producto y en la atención de los clientes en sus ratos libres. Considera su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja. Le gusta su actividad porque le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede apoyar a su pareja en los gastos de su hogar, pues tuvo que dejar su empleo de cuidar niños por su avanzada edad. No le gusta que haya altibajos en las ventas, ya que algunas veces no logra vender todo lo que ofrece al público, pero no se desanima.  Espera poder mantener su negocio y seguir contando con su sustento diario ya que por su edad no podrá conseguir empleo. Adicionalmente quiere dedicarse a otra actividad que es la venta de prendas de vestir en otras ciudades o centros poblados alejados de la ciudad. Este es el préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos, está comprometida al pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles, comprará prendas de vestir usadas y de esta forma espera mejorar su economía.
texts.en: Florinda, 65, is a friendly woman, enterprising and hard-working.  Her husband, Felix, is a farmer.  The couple have 6 children, two of whom--Freddy, 37, and Carlos, 19--live with them.  The rest are independent of their parents.  The family live in a house that they own.  Florinda operates a platanos sales business.  She has a food stall in front of her house and meets her customers there.  Most of her customers are local people.  They say that she is friendly and considerate and that she is respected as a valued resident of the neighborhood.  Florinda has operated the business for 4 years.  Her children help her with the business, buying merchandise and tending to customers.  She says that the business is profitable and that she likes being her own boss and contributing to the family's expenses.  She worked taking care of other people's children before and says that she quit when she decided that she was too old enough to go on.  Now she wants to start a clothing sales business.  She plans to buy used clothing from markets in other towns and resell them locally.  This is Florinda's 8th MFP loan.  She says that she is grateful to lenders for supporting her business and helping her work to meet her goals.  She is committed, she says, to repaying the loan on time.  Florinda will use this 500 new soles loan to buy used clothing for her clothing sales business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing that she will resell.

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
One of the breadwinners in a family consisting of five children, two of whom are students and the remaining three of whom are paid workers in Thailand, Theourn is 42-year-old farmer. She grows rice on four hectares of land and her husband catches fish to sell. For 21 years Theourn has been working in this business and she can earn about 11,000 KHR per day.

Thoeurn has never had a loan from VisionFund before. Now, she is in a group with four other female members and she is a group leader. With portion of the loan, Theourn is going to plow her rice farm and buy a small boat for supporting her husband's business. She hopes that her husband can catch more fish to sell so that she can have extra income for her children.

loans.use: To plow her rice farm and buy a small boat

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Phon, aged 47 and married, is a rural citizen from Kro Lanh district, Siem Reap Province. She has managed the basic daily needs of her household by farming rice and raising pigs. To earn extra income, her husband also buys cows for resale and provides a motor taxi service in the area. 

Phon, in a group with four members, is a second-time borrower. One of her co-members is also a second-time borrower and the remaining two are first-time borrowers. The past loan, which Phon has completely paid back, has helped her to sustain her household gradually. As a group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy more pigs for raising. She expects to get a good retun so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy more pigs for raising

loans.name: Hut's Group

texts.en:
Hut is a resident of Moung Russey district in Battambang Province. She is 40 years old and has five children. To cover her family's basic needs, she earns a living through rice cultivation and pineapple growing. She has been involved in this business for 15 years, earning about 28,000 KHR per day.

Hut's group has two female members. As first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), the group members are each seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As a group leader, Hut is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to grow her crops on time so as to generate more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice and pineapple crops.

loans.name: Suvonkul

texts.ru: Сувонкул проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 51 год. Он женат. У него шестеро. Сувонкул зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Животноводством он занимается 7 лет. Сувонкул берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Suvonkul lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 51 years old, married, and has 6 children. Suvonkul earns a living by raising cattle. He has been working in animal husbandry for 7 years. Suvonkul is now seeking a loan in order to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Nin's Group

texts.en:
Nin is 32 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. 

To support the family, she has working as a tailor, and her husband also supplements the income through his small business, housing construction. She has been with this business for 10 years.

Nin has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles. The other members have been with VisionFund from three to four cycles. She has fully repaid the loans, which have helped her to better support her current business. 

Now she is leading her group of three to ask a loan. Nin will use her portion to buy a machine for supporting her husband’s business in cutting tiles. She hopes this loan will support her husband's business and add up to more income, so she can improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a tile cutting machine to support her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Sovan's Group

texts.en:
Aged 58, Sovan is a widowed mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her. To feed the children, she has farmed rice for twenty years, and supplemented the family’s income by growing various kinds of vegetables such as cabbages, chilies, and cucumbers. The current business earns her approximately 24,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day after offsetting expenses.  Lacking of working capital to support her business is still the main challenge.

This is the first microloan for Sovan’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group of two to ask for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and pesticides for her farm. 

She hopes this loan will enable her crop yield to become more productive and profitable so she can sell it for a good price to make a good living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида очень трудолюбивая женщина. Более 20 лет она работает в школе учительницей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант и их доход не хватает  на содержания 2  детей. Саида хочет стать бизнес леди и заработать много денег. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей   продуктов питания. Ее магазин будет расположен рядом с ее домом. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Saida is a very hard-working woman. For the past 20 years, she has been working as a schoolteacher. Her husband is a migrant worker, but their salaries are not sufficient to support their 2 children. Saida wants to become a businesswoman and make a lot of money. To that end, she took a course entitled "To Get Ahead" that was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she earned a certificate. 

Saida wants to set up her own business of selling groceries. Her shop will be located near her house. She plans to use the income generated to provide her children with a good education and nutritious food. Saida is seeking a loan in the amount of 5,000 Tajikistan Somoni to buy inventory in order to start her business. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy food items to establish a new business

loans.name: Fortin

texts.es:
Fortin, de 36 años de edad, es un hombre alegre y activo, además de ser empeñoso y trabajador. Es conviviente con Lupe quien se dedica al comercio y es madre de sus 2 hijos llamados Ibet de 10 y Junis de 6 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos  viven con sus dos hijos en su casa propia que pudo comprar gracias luego de muchos años de esfuerzo. 


El trabajo que realiza Fortin es la compra y venta de bebidas alcohólicas y gaseosas. Tiene un pequeño bar que esta implementando poco a poco en un terreno que ha comprado en un barrio muy transitado. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 9 meses y le esta yendo muy bien. Trabaja con la ayuda de su pareja y eso lo motiva a seguir adelante. Además, tiene una fábrica donde elabora escobas y por si fuera poco también tiene un lavadero de vehículos acondicionado al costado de su bar. Anteriormente dedicaba su tiempo laboral a la venta de artefactos usados, este trabajo le permitió ahorrar por algunos y de esta forma emprendió otros negocios y poco a poco ha logrado mejorar su situación económica y familiar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la tranquilidad con la que genera sus ingresos, reconoce que no ha sido fácil sobresalir en ninguna de sus actividades ya que la competencia muchas veces ha jugado en su contra haciéndolo pensar en desistir de lo que ya había avanzado. Sin embargo, impulsado por el amor a su familia ha salido de todos esos percances y continúa en el camino al éxito. Ahora espera ampliar su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio por el bien de su familia. Este es el préstamo número 3 con MFP, se siente contento y agradecido por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para continuar con su negocio, además se siente a gusto con el asesor de crédito y con los miembros de su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y los considera personas responsables. El dinero solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de cervezas y gaseosas para continuar vendiendo en su pequeño bar, además comprará detergentes y una manguera para implementar su negocio de lavado de vehículos.
texts.en:
Fortin, 36, is a friendly man, enterprising and hard-working.  His wife, Lupe, has a retail business.  The couple have 2 children: Ibet, 10, and Junis, 6.  The family own the house where they live, a house they worked hard to pay for.  

Fortin operates a liquor and soft drinks sales business.  He has a small bar, in a well-trafficked part of the city, that he is slowly expanding on a plot of land that he owns.  He has operated the business for 9 months and says that he is satisfied with his progress.  His wife helps him with the business.  He wants to better provide for his family and says that they are the reason that he works hard.  The bar isn't his only business.  He also has a broom-making business and, if that and the bar weren't enough, a carwash that he operates next to the bar.  He sold used merchandise before and saved enough to start the first of his string of businesses.  He has grown bit by bit, always with the goal of making a better life for his family.  He likes being his own boss, he says, even though it's been difficult at times.  Competition from other similar businesses has led him to wonder if he could go on, but he always perservered, carried on by the love and support of his family.  This is Fortin's 3rd MFP loan and he says that he is grateful for your support.  He wants to thank the staff of the bank and the other members of his community bank, as well, for their support.  Fortin will use this 1500 new soles loan to stock his bar with beer and soft drinks.  He also wants to buy a hose and detergents for his carwash business.

loans.use: to stock his catering business.

loans.name: Loun

texts.en:
Loun is 43 years old, widowed, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed her children through raising pigs, producing rice wine, and selling grocery items, all of which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns about 30,000KHR per day and saves around 10,000 KHR per day after daily expenses.
 
Loun is requesting her fifth loan from VisonFund for 1,000,000 KHR, which she will use to buy a pot for producing rice wine and more piglets for raising. She repaid her past loans, which have helped her. She hopes this loan will help her to improve her current business and increase her income in order to have better living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase a pot for producing rice wine and piglets for raising.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, 51, is a farmer who lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He has six children, two of whom are dependent on him and still in school. He is a rice farmer on two-hectares of farmland and is raising one pig. Engaging in this activity for thirty-one years, he is able to earn about 17,000 KHR per day and save about 6,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for his rice paddy-field business. 

Heng is a first cycle client with VisionFund. He is seeking for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. With this loan, he is going to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to grow her rice more fruitfully and timely so as to improve his standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Proung

texts.en:
Proung is a rural farmer who lives in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 44 years old and has three children. She has farmed rice on three-hectare area of farmland for fifteen years and supplements family’s income by growing rubber trees. The current business earns her approximately 20,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Proung has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to buy more rubber tree seedling for planting. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy rubber seedlings for planting and use a portion of it to spend on buying fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rubber seedlings for planting and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun lives in a rural village of the Dambae distrct of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a 31-year-old mother of one son who is still dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she has been in farming rice and growing cassava on two-hectares of farmland. Involved in this business for 11 years, she is able to earn about 60,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. The low sales price of cassava is still the main challenge to her business.

Oun received the first loan with VisionFund a cycle ago. She successfully repaid the past loan which has helped her to relieve family’s burden and improve livelihood. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes her crop yield will become more productive so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Eliphaz

texts.en:
Eliphaz is a 49-year-old man with six children living in the Kicwamba area of Uganda. All his children are in school.
He is a farmer of bananas and has been thinking of building a house for his family for quite some time.  As you can see he has some of the materials already to build the house but needs more products to initiate and complete the building. Eliphaz's family needs a place to call their own to ensure safety and security for the children as they grow up.

loans.use: to build a house for his family

loans.name: Ugul

texts.ru: Угул очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Ее муж  получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Угул решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес с купле продажей  мыло. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ugul is a very hard-working woman. She is married and is raising 5 children. Her husband earns a small salary that is not sufficient to provide the family with all the necessities. Ugul has decided to help her husband for the well-being of the family. To that end, she took a course entitled "To Get Ahead" that was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she earned a certificate. Now Ugul is fully able to set up her own business and to be successful at it. 

Ugul wants to establish a business of selling soap. She plans to use the income she makes to provide her children with a good education and nutritious food. Ugul is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,500 Tajikistan Somoni to buy inventory with which to start her business. She is waiting for your kind assistance.
