She is requesting this loan to purchase more coal so she can increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more coal so she can increase her sales.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is involved in agriculture. He breeds cows and hens and grows fruit trees. Karen earns his main income from the sales of agricultural products in the local markets. In order to gather more milk, Karen has applied for this loan to purchase a cow. He also wants to buy forage to feed the cattle during winter. 

Karen lives with his parents and sister. Development of agriculture is absolutely vital for the family to earn additional income, make savings and create better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage.

location.town: Vernashen village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms Naseem is a 54-year-old married woman. She is very innovative and despite having no proper education she is very talented in creating art designs. Her husband works in a car repairing shop and earns insufficient funds to support his family alone. 

Because her husband’s income is too low to support the seven members of the family, so she started her own business. She does beautiful embroidery on bed sheets and towels and then sells them in the market. Her collection is very famous in her town. Her customer base is diverse and she serves her community well. In this way she is able to contribute to the family income. 

She is well satisfied and happy with the support of Kashf Foundation. She requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy more bed sheets and towels in bulk to increase her business. This will drive up her sales and will help in generating more income. She wishes to utilize the earned profit on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets and towels in bulk to increase her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Sinkor. She is single with three children aged two, five and nine who all live at home and attend school.

For the past ten years now, she has been running a table stall in the market where she sells fish. She started this business with help from her father, and learned how to sell from her mother. She likes her business because it allows her to make profits and makes her popular.

She requested this loan to purchase more fish for her business. She wants to make more money to build her house as she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa, de 45 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, amable y le gusta los negocios.  Es casada con David quien es trabajador independiente y padre de sus 02 hijos.  Vive  en compañía de sus dos hijos  y su pareja, habitando en  la  casa que es de su propiedad. El negocio que tiene Luisa es la venta de suplementos nutricionales como ganoderma a base de café, iniciándose por la idea de una amiga que le hizo conocer el negocio, ahora  ella misma trae desde la capital, realizando viajes periódicos y en ocasiones encarga la  compra a un familiar que vive en la capital, para luego venderlo de forma ambulatoria y personalizada a sus vecinos, familiares y conocidos muchas veces al contado y otras a crédito.  
Lleva realizando éste negocio desde hace 08 meses y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones como el ayudar a muchas personas en el cuidado de su salud, también el ingreso económico con lo cual puede darles una mejor educación a sus hijos  y el sentirse una empresaria que cada día se va desarrollándose más y progresando. Al contrario le incomoda cuando alguno de su clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos, pero aun así desea continuar y crecer en su negocio. Este es préstamo número 02  con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de un stock de mayor volumen de estos productos y a menos costo y a la vez comprará ropas de vestir para venderlas. Ella espera apoyar en el tratamiento de enfermedades de muchas personas con este productos y aumentar sus márgenes de ganancia.
texts.en:
Luisa, 45, is a hard-working, kind woman who likes business activity.  She is married to David, who is an independent worker and the father of their two children.  They live in their own house.  Luisa sells health supplements, such as coffe-based Ganoderma.  She started the business through a friend who gave her the idea.  She brings the merchandise from the capity city, which she visits periodically.  Sometimes she asks a relative who lives in the capital to make the purchase for her.  She sells the goods door-to-door to her neighbors, family and acquaintances on both cash and credit bases.  She has been in business for eight months and, for now, works alone.

She feels the business is good because of the profits she makes.  En enjoys what she does because of the satisfaction she receives by helping people care for their health.  The income also allows her give her children a better education, while making her feel like a business woman who is evolving more and more each day.  What she is uncomfortable with is when a customer gets behind in his or her credit.  But she still wants to continue and grow her business.

This is her second loan through MFP.  She hopes you will help her meet her goals.  She also says she likes her communal bank because the members are responsible, supportive people.  The loan in the amount of 800 PEN will be used to buy a larger stock of products at a lower cost.  She will also buy clothing to sell.  She hopes to be able to help people cure their illnesses with these products, and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy health products and clothing.

loans.name: Arkadia

texts.en:
Arkadia lives with his parents, wife and two school-age children in Malishka village, Vayots Dzor region. Arkadia breeds pigs and hens. He got involved in breeding four years ago. Currently Arkadia keeps four pigs and 12 hens. 

Arkadia would like to increase the number of pigs, for which he needs sufficient funds. Arkadia also plans to purchase forage for the pigs, as the forage he has reserved is not enough to feed more pigs. This loan will help Arkadia to implement these objectives and earn more income from the sales of pig meat.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and forage.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Ms Rehana is married and has three children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Two years ago she began salon work in her house. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

She is currently in her 4th loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 30,000 from Kashf. She wants to use this loan amount to buy raw material including facial cream, hair straightener, a hair dryer etc, to meet her customers’ demand. This will mean she can increase her revenues and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including facial cream, hair straightener and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Ms Naziran is 50 years old, living in a village of Khudian. She has been in the milk-sales business for a few years. Her husband is involved with agriculture and doesn’t earn enough to fulfil the needs of the family members alone. She has three children and there are a total of five members in her home and her husband is the sole earner of the family. 

Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she purchased a buffalo five years ago and started selling the milk in her community. Now her customers have increased and she wants to purchase another buffalo. For this reason she wants the loan of PKR 20,000. 

She is satisfied with the support of Kashf foundation as she has taken several loans for the growth of her business. She is hopeful to earn more income and intends to use it on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Siftan

texts.en:
Ms Siftan is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last many years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy stocks of rice and flour and other general items from the market at lower rates. She then will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy stocks of rice, flour, oil, tea and soaps.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in Sinkor with five children aged between two and 17 years old. Her children live at home and attend school. She stopped her education in the 6th grade. 

For seven years she has been selling door paint, nails, hinges, etc in her community. She started this business with a loan from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more door paint, nails, hinges, etc for her business. She enjoys the way her customers buy from her. In the near future she want to own a car and become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more door paint, nails and hinges for her business.

loans.name: Manah

texts.fr: Dame de 46ans, madame Adjovi est mariée à un revendeur. Ils ont 04 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. L’ainé est âgé de 22ans et le dernier 11ans. C’est depuis 2006, qu’il a démarré son activité de vente de cartes de recharges dans une boutique. Elle veut élargir son activité et aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer c’est pour cela, elle sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES pour s’acheter des marchandises (cartes de recharges) auprès des sociétés de communication afin de tirer profit et atteindre son objectif.
texts.en: Adjovi is a 46 year old woman who is married to a re-seller. They have four children, all of whom spend their days on the wooden benches of school. The oldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 11 years old. Since 2006, Adjovi has been selling top-up cards of mobile credit in a small store. She hopes to expand her activity and help her husband take care of the home expenses. In order to do so, she is asking for her first loan from WAGES to purchase larger quantities of merchandise from communication companies in order to increase her sales and be more profitable.

loans.use: purchase top-up cards for mobile credit

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Ms. Munawaris is a passionate woman who works selling cosmetics and ribbons. She works day and night to give her family all the basic necessities of life. Her collection of cosmetics and ribbons is very famous in her town. She offers a variety of ribbons in different colors and designs to her customers and makes enough money to lead a decent life.

She is a loving mother of four kids who are all going to school. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has steadily improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a new stock of cosmetics and ribbons of different colors in various designs. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support for her family.

loans.use: To buy new stock of cosmetics and ribbons of different colors in various designs.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Ms Shagufta is a 40-year-old active, married woman. She is efficiently doing a milk-selling business. Most of her clients are her neighbors. She makes enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is employed in a small general store and one of her sons works in a repair shop. However, their income is very unpredictable and not enough to cover everyday expenditures. 

She is a loving mother of three children. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy another cow to meet the increasing demand from her customers. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family and will spend a part of her earnings on the education of her two daughters.

loans.use: To buy another cow to meet the increasing demand from her customers.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a very hard-working woman and supports her family very well. Her cloth business is good. She is a passionate woman and has been doing stitching work for one year.

She is a loving mother of one child. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has steadily improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of fancy cloth of different colors and various designs with lace and patterns in thread etc. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fancy cloth of different colors and various designs with lace and thread patterns.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr: Mr Gilbert est âgé de 42ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et est mère de 03 enfants. Les deux âgés de 12 et 08ans sont scolarisés. Quant au dernier de 02ans, il ne va pas encore à l’école. Il est éleveur de porcs et exerce l’activité il y a 08ans. Il vend ses porcs aux charcutiers et aux restaurateurs dans sa ferme et une personne l’aide dans l’exécution de ses travaux. Il sollicite un second prêt à WAGES pour acheter des porcs et les nourritures leur permettant de les engraisser. Avec les profits, il veut avoir une grande ferme et voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en: Mr Gilbert is a 42 year old man, married to a re-seller, with whom he has three children. Their children are aged 2, 8 and 12 years old, the two oldest attend school. He has been raising pigs and selling pork products for the past 8 years. He sells his pork to butchers and restaurants, and has one person working on the farm to help him with his work. He is asking for a second loan from WAGE in order to purchase more pigs and feed them, thus enabling them to gain more weight. He plans to use his profits to increase his farm and see his family enriched.

loans.use: purchase pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger volume of clothes.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is married and has five children. Since she is from a low-income household, she decided to start her own business. Now she is supporting her household.

Both Suriya and her husband earn money to cover the family's daily expenses and to provide a better future for their children.
 
She has been familiar with stitching techniques from a young age. At the moment, she has a big client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community.

Suriya is requesting a loan of Rs 20,000 to stock up on coloured threads, buttons, needles, etc. This way, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers and continue the business without fail.

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children, through her hard work and sincerity.

loans.use: to stock up on coloured threads, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Salley

texts.en:
Salley is 28 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has three children between the ages of four and twelve.

She sells coal in her community and has been involved in this business for the past ten years. Since she is the only coal retailer, she makes a profit. With this profit she buys more coal to sell and contributes to her family's expenses.

Salley is requesting a loan to purchase more coal for the business. In the future, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for the business.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece  al banco comunal NUEVA VIDA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

El socio Aníbal, el socio  tiene 44 años de edad, soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi, él socio trabaja años brindando este servicio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio trabaja de lunes a domingo durante el dia,el socio a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes ,el socio cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas nuevas para su carro.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de manualidades, venta de zapatos, crianza de cuyes, venta de golosinas, confección de ropa, taxi.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

El socio se  siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the NUEVA VIDA communal bank. This bank is located in the Wanchaq district, in the Cusco province and department. 

The member, Aníbal, is 44 years old. He is single. He alternates his daily activities with a taxi service. He has offered this service for years. His business is going well due to the effort he puts in his work every day. He works from Monday to Sunday during the day. He also raises small animals like guinea pigs. He raises these little animals in order to later sell them to customers who request them. Aníbal is a responsible and hard-working person which allows him to move ahead. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase tires for his vehicle. 

The other members have businesses related to handicrafts, shoe sales, raising guinea pigs, candy sales, clothes making and taxis.

The members enclosed at the bottom of the photo are those who requested permission to come the meeting late for work reasons.

loans.use: purchase new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Krubo

texts.en:
Krubo is 54 years old, married, and has adult children.  She lives in Sinkor and sells charcoal in the local market, which she has been doing for three years.  She started this business with help from her oldest daughter.  

Krubo is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more charcoal for her business.  She plans to expand her business since she has more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is 29 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school. With her husband, she runs a business selling milk, which she has been doing for five years. They have one buffalo and sell its milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  Uzma tends to and milks the buffalo while her husband sells their products at different places on daily basis. 

Uzma is requesting a loan for 20,000 PKR, which she will use to buy another buffalo to cater to more customers. They need to earn additional income to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing, and education. They hope to increase in their production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa, a 53-year-old married mother of two children aged 20 and 30, lives in Sinkor where, for the past two years, she has been running a table market where she sells rice , pepper, bitter ball, vita, and others items. She started this venture with help from her father, from whom she learned the business, enjoying it for both the profits she earns and the interactions she has with her customers.

Massa is requesting a loan to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, vita, and others items. She wants to earn more money to build her house upon a piece of land that she owns.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, vita, etc.

loans.name: Gladys Georgina

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

La señora Gladys, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos, tres de ellos mayores de edad y una  de 17 años, todos sus hijos son independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar (licuadoras, planchas, colchones, entre otras muchas cosas mas) su forma de venta es por cartillas y por sistema acumulativo. Trabaja tres días por semana en todas sus actividades ya que ella tiene que ofrecer el producto, hacer los pedidos, retirar de la distribuidora y entregar los productos para cobrar cada quince días, estos productos son entregados de acuerdo al número que les haya tocado a los clientes que van del uno al diez. Lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar colchones, planchas, licuadoras, sabanas entre otras cosas. Lleva cuatro años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer  crédito empezó su negocio con el cual se gana la vida honradamente.
 
Su sueño es tener un local o una distribuidora de estos productos.
texts.en:
In La Pila of the Montecristi Cantón the communal bank “La Pila” meets every fifteen days.  This place is very well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture.  One can find a great variety of crafts that are made by its inhabitants following the traditional customs. 

Gladys is 51 years old, is married and from this relationship she has four children.  Three of them are adults and one is 17 years old and all of her children are independent.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good homemaker who also makes a living in business.  She sells items for the home (blenders, irons and mattresses among many other things).  Her method of sales is by a type of layaway account and by cumulative system (of small, regular payments).  She works three days a week in all of her activities since she has to offer the product, make the orders, collect from the distributor and deliver the products in order to be paid every fifteen days.  These products are delivered according to the number of customers that she has been in touch with that range from one to ten.  She has been in this business for four years. 

This loan is to purchase mattresses, irons, blenders and sheets among other things.  She has been in the communal bank for four years and she likes it because with the first loan she began her business with which she earns a living honestly. 

Her dream is to have her own business premises or a distribution company of these products.

loans.use: to buy mattresses, irons, blenders, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Higuerón  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado Higuerón en la ciudad de Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúnen las 17 socias del Banco Comunal  Higuerón. Las mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, comercio en general, entre otras actividades. Al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse  hace un tiempo atrás para poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La Fundación Espoir.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Jessica Patricia, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que él a veces no gana mucho se dedica a la venta de ropa por cátalo y de productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien,  lo que más vende son los perfumes.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan tanto a ella como a sus compañeros, por lo cual están muy agradecidos y contentos todos en el grupo. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the 17 members of the Higueron communal bank meet in a place called Higuerón in the city of Portoviejo. They earn their living through diverse activities such as agriculture and shopkeeping (amongst other activities). When they heard about the benefits that the institution affords they decided to unite to be able to access the loans offered by Fundacion Espoir.

One of the members of this group is Jessica Patricia, who is 27 years old, married and from this marriage has two children of 8 and 6 years of age who study at the school. Her husband works in agriculture.

She is a homemaker and sometimes she sells clothes via catalogue and Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She does this so that she can obtain her own income and with this be able to help her husband with the household expenses since sometimes he does not earn very much. She works three days a week from two to three hours a day, and she sells on credit, requiring repayment every eight days. She has been carrying on this business for 4 years and it is going very well for her. The thing she sells most of is perfume. 

She will use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothes. This is her third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the help they give her as much as to her colleagues, for which they are all very grateful and happy. 

Her dream is to be able to provide the best future for her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Eddy Didi

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Eddy, 43 años de edad está casado y tiene 1 hijo, él se dedica a la fabricación de estructuras metálicas de todo tipo en su taller de carpintería metalica.  Eddy está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material como varillas metálicas de diferentes medidas para la producción de su taller.
Eddy está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica la cual le da los ingresos para la educación de su hijo. El pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Eddy is 43 years old and is married with one son. He earns his living making all sorts of metallic structures is his metal carpentry workshop. He is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as metal rods of various lengths for his workshop production. 

Eddy is very grateful to Kiva for helping him with his business which provides him with income for the education of his son. He belongs to the communal bank  “KANCHARY” in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy metal rods for his workshop.

loans.name: Josefa Ilaria

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín que se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y  del Ecuador.

La señora Josefa tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es el jefe del cuerpo de bomberos.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado ganar sus propios ingresos por su cuenta, tiene una dulcería en su casa, dulces que ella misma prepara y que son muy solicitados por sus clientes, ella también prepara para recepciones o fiestas al por mayor pero estos los prepara bajo pedido que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación. Lleva más de 5 años con este negocio y le agrada ya que ahí se entretiene y realiza lo que a ella le gusta.

Este crédito es para comprar azúcar, frutas, harina, huevos, etc. necesarios para preparar los dulces. Lleva 14 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Junín communal bank meets every two weeks in the Junín canton.  This place is known for its kind and hardworking people.  It is also known as the place where the best liquor in the province and in Ecuador is distilled.

Josefa, age 56, is married, and they have three children.  The children are all grown, and two of them still live in her house.  Her husband is the chief of the fire department.

She is a very hard-working woman who has always liked earning her own income on her own.  She has a candy shop at her house.  She makes the candy herself, and it is in high demand by her customers.  She also makes candy wholesale for receptions or parties.  However, she makes these by orders that her customers place in advance.  She has had this business for over five years.  It pleases her because it keeps her busy, and she makes what she likes.

This loan is to buy sugar, fruit, flour, and eggs, etc.  She needs these items to make the candy.  She has been in the communal bank for 14 years, and she likes the help that the loans provide.

Her dreams are to get ahead and to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fruit, flour, and eggs, etc.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 46 years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lanie has a motorcycle rentals business in the Philippines. 

Lanie requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment.

Lanie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram lives in Nor Dvin village, Ararat region, with his father, his sister, his wife, two 8-year-old daughters and a 1-year-old son.

Aram is involved in agriculture. He breeds cows and grows apricot, peach, pomegranate and apple trees. 

Aram has applied for this loan to purchase forage for the cows. He also needs to improve his orchard by purchasing fertilizer. In addiiton, Aram needs investments to pay for watering the land. This is important for Aram for gathering a good harvest next season, from the sales of which he earns a considerable part of his agricultural income. Development of the farm is important for him to ensure economic stability for the family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, forage and watering costs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 39 years old. She is single and she has one daughter who is currently in school. She lives in Kisauni neighborhood in the city of Mombasa. She has a restaurant where she works with her two employees from  6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. The business is four years old. Her business is well known and has lots of customers.

The loan she is requesting is for purchasing ingredients for making different foods. She will buy soft drinks, meats, vegetables, eggs, flour, beans and rice. The loan will help her grow her business and profits. She will be able to help her child with her studies since she has no other support from anyone.

Her dreams are that her business will become bigger and that her daughter will be a professional.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meats, vegetables, eggs, flour, beans and rice.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel works hard to support her family. Richel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Richel requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Richel has been in this business for 13 years now, and she also earns additional income from her variety store.

In the future, Richel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy windows and doors for her house renovation.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian, a 54-year-old married mother of three, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has had a food production business in the Philippines for 30 years. Now requesting a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food enterprise, Vivian would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: El Renacer De Chacrasana Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! El grupo “El Renacer de Chacrasana” es un grupo que está iniciando su 6to ciclo, conformado por 7 mujeres responsables y solidarias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es María, que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace más de 2 años.

María tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Fue una de sus amigas quien la motivó a emprender dicho negocio y se siente feliz pues gracias a su trabajo a podido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de productos de belleza como colonias, talcos, cremas, entre otros.

El sueño de María es tener una bodega la cual le genere mayores ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

María agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada ya que hace posible su progreso. En la fotografía, María es la primera del lado derecho, en pie, y viste casaca color beige.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  The El Renacer de Chacrasana group is starting its sixth cycle.  It is comprised of seven responsible and supportive women.

María is one of the members of this group.  She has been selling beauty products for over two years.  María, age 28, is married and has two minor children.  It was one of her friends that motivated her to undertake said business.  She is happy because, thanks to her work, she has been able to support her husband with the household expenses.

The requested loan is to buy beauty products like cologne, talcum powder, and creams, among others.

María’s dream is to have a grocery store, which would generate greater income.  This would improve her family’s quality of life.  María is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help provided because this makes it possible for her to progress.

In the photo María is the first one on the right.  She is standing, and she is wearing beige jacket.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like cologne, talcum powder, and creams, among others.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She is a very hard working lady. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle with Kashf foundation and she has been in the business of cloth sewing for the last four years. 

When she started this business, her income was very low, but with the passage of time, demand for her clothes increased in her community. 

Her husband is a driver and his monthly income is very low to support his family. She has one machine and now she wants to purchase one more sewing machine for her daughter to increase sewing capacity. For this she requested a loan amount of PKR 30,000. So then her family income will increase and they will be able enough to manage their household. 

Her loan has been approved by Kashf Foundation. Her husband is very happy to see the increasing growth of her business. Now she is saving a healthy amount of income for their better future. She wants to give better education to her children and also to build a good home for her family.

loans.use: To buy one more sewing machine.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 32-year-old married man, father of two children. He has been working in the eggs wholesale trade since 2010, and since that time his work has been expanding in a very managed way. 

Mohamad has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four cycles, with a good-standing payback history and a clear business development upon a set plan.

Mohamad is the only one in the region who distributes eggs wholesale, and this is a positive aspect to keep on improving his business more and more.

Through a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, Mohamad will increase his business capital through increasing the quantity of eggs he sells. This will surely increase his income and improve his family's living.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of eggs he sells.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is taking out a new loan to expand her existing business. She is a hardworking and dedicated woman who is liked by many people in her vicinity. 

Jackline says that since the last loan, her living standards have improved. Her customers have been increasing every day but she has not enough capital to meet their needs. For this reason then, she turned to Yehu to ask for a loan so as to buy a drier, shampoo, and a weaver. 

She hopes to improve the services she offers and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a drier, shampoo, and a weaver.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, 22, lives with her friend at Kakata. She stopped her education in the 11th grade. She has a 5-year-old child who is in school.  Esther sells bread,  cool water and juice at the community school. She has had this business for the past three years. She learned to sell from her father and she is making a profit to improve her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more mineral water, bread and packs of juice for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more mineral water, bread and packs of juice for her business.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Ms. Hameeda is a 50-year-old, active, married woman. The man shown in the photo is Hameeda’s husband. He has been in the hand embroidery business for the last 10 years. His collection is very famous in her town. He has received a lot of appreciation from her community members. He makes enough to lead a decent life. 

Hameeda is a loving mother of two children and wants to increase the family income. On behalf of her husband, she has requested a loan of Rs 25000 to buy a stock of threads, sequins and pearls in different colors to meet increasing demand for her embroidery designs.  He hopes to make more profit and thus provide better support for his family, and he will spend a part of the earnings on his two daughter’s education.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads, sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Asnatu

texts.en:
Asnatu, 42, was born in a village called Affair but now lives in Kabala, a town in Northern Sierra Leone, with her husband and four children. Asnatu has been in business for 10 years selling market food such as palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc.  

Asnatu has requested a loan of 2,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones from Kiva field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), in order to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock. In this way, her business will improve both in size and quality, attracting many customers.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 40 years old, married to Simon and is blessed with five children ages 18, 12, 9, 7 and 4 months. She runs a retail business she started 12 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She has requested a first loan of KES 10,000 to purchase rice and sugar to sell in her shop. The profit will be reinvested in her business. She hopes to make this business grow as well as to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en: Fareeda is a married woman and wants to support her husband financially. The man shown in the photo is Fareeda’s husband. He has been in the shoe-making business for the last five years. He has excellent skills and has a good client list. Fareeda has seven members in her family and her husband is the sole breadwinner in the family. He needs to increase sales to earn more and fulfill the basic needs of the family. Fareeda requested a loan of Rs 20,000/- to buy raw materials such as leather, plastic leather, polishes etc to increase production. In this way her husband would be able to increase his sales and earn more income. He intends to utilize part of the profits on his family's betterment and well-being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather, plastic leather, polishes etc.for shoe making.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 33 years old, married and blessed with four children. She owns a retail shop, a business she has had for six years now and earns a monthly income of KES 45,000. 

She has requested an eighth loan worth KES 100,000 to purchase 10 crates of sodas, 10 bales of maize flour, five bales of washing detergents, wheat flour, and bar soaps. 

The profit she earns would be ploughed back into her business. Her dream is to see this business grow to a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy  sodas, maize flour, washing detergents, wheat flour, and bar soaps

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 35 years old, married to Norah and blessed with four children that he supports. He operates a motorcycle transport business as well as dairy farming in Narok. He has been in the business for the last four years earning an income of 30,000 KES monthly. 

Robert is servicing his second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD that will facilitate the purchase of another motorcycle to boost his transport business. He intends to use to use anticipated profits to support business and provide for basic family needs. His future dream is to be financially stable

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: 1 De Mayo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
1 de Mayo es un banco comunal que esta conformado por 8 mujeres que viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que se caracteriza por sus paisajes gracias a su geografía accidenta, tiene un clima frió, su centro se mezcla entre la arquitectura moderna y la antigua. Su gente mantiene aun su cultura y tradiciones siendo su mayor orgullo, se dedican a la cría de animales, a la agricultura, al comercio y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer diferentes actividades económicas o han migrado en busca de una mejor estabilidad económica para sus familias. Nuestras socias son mujeres que ven en su trabajo diario la oportunidad de sacar adelante a sus familias, son carismáticas y de un corazón cálido.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Sra. Norma, se encuentra ingresando al banco comunal 1 de Mayo, aceptando la invitación de su cuñada quien forma parte del grupo hace algún tiempo, es muy joven tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha procreado una hija que tiene 3 años de edad, su esposo labora diariamente como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia y vive en casa de sus suegros con quienes comparte los gastos de la casa.

Ella es de profesión costurera aprendió esta actividad estudiando en una academia y ahora es su forma de vida, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde realizando toda clase de costuras. También en su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes.

Su crédito lo va a invertir para el pago de una cuota de entrada para comprarse una máquina de coser.
 
Su meta es tener un taller de costura más grande.
texts.en:
1 de Mayo, or First of May, is a communal bank that is made up of 8 women that live near the parish Cumbe in Cuenca, a place that is characterized by its landscape due to it's accidental geography. It has a cold climate and its center mixed between modern and ancient architecture. Its people maintain their culture and traditions still being its greatest pride. Its people are in livestock, agriculture, business and many go out into the city daily to exercise different economic activities or have migrated in search of better economic stability for their families. Our members are women that see in their daily work the opportunity in succeed for their families. They are charismatic and of warm hearts.

One of the members of this group is Norma. She invested in the communal bank 1 de Mayo, accepting the invitation from her sister-in-law who had been part of the group for some time. She is very young, only 23 years old. She is married and has a 3 year-old daughter. Her husband works daily as a private employee. She does not have her own house and lives with her in-laws with whom she shares the household expenses.

She is a professional seamstress. She learned this trade studying in an academy and now it is her way of life. She works from Monday to Friday from 8 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon doing all kinds of stitching. Also, in her home she raises guinea pigs.

Her loan will go towards investing in a down payment to buy herself a sewing machine.

Her goal is to have a larger seamstress shop.

loans.use: to pay the payment for a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rusia

texts.en:
Rusia is 47 years old, married to Aggrey, a driver, and blessed with five children ages 17 (twins), 16, 14 and 9 years, respectively. Rusia owns a hotel, a business she started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

She has requested a second loan of 30,000 KES to purchase two sacks of beans, five sacks of maize, and chicken for use in her hotel. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to buy a piece of land and build rental houses as well as educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of beans, five sacks of maize, and chicken

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza lives in Yerevan with her husband and 2 children: 9-year-old son and 5-year-old daughter. Eliza runs a little booth, where she trades in women's clothing. She started this business in 2010. Eliza would like to refresh the clothing variety in her booth for the coming high winter season. This is important for Eliza to keep successful running of the business and earn a stable income.

loans.use: to pay for women's clothing

loans.name: Gadah

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Gadah prefers that her photo is not on the internet; thus the above photo is of her mother. Gadah is a 32-year-old single woman from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. In the future, she would like to expand her project by opening a shop and to expand her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Bahoridin

texts.ru: Бахоридину 48 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Он работает бухгалтером в организации и имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства, но его доход не хватает для того, чтобы обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами.  Бахоридин хочет, чтобы ее дети выросли  в достатке. Бахоридин не в состоянии оплатить за учебы дочери в университете. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 450 долларов США для оплаты учебы дочери. Бахоридин и ее умная дочь ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bahoridin is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children. He works as a bookkeeper for an organization and supplements his income by raising cattle. However, his income is not sufficient for him to provide his family with all the necessities. Bahoridin wants to meet the needs of his children as they grow up, but he is not a position to afford to pay for his daughter's university education. He is seeking a loan in the amount of 450 US dollars to pay for her studies. Bahoridin and his intelligent daughter are waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter’s education

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FUENTE DE VIDA, él banco se encuentra situado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia tiene 43 años de edad, 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio  de venta de artesania,la socia vende textiles como chompas,  chalinas, guantes, chuyos entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como turistas ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como chompas de alpaca.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the “Source of Life” Communal Bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.  She is 43 years old, has 2 children, and is married. Her daily activities center around her business selling artisan goods. She sells textiles such as sweaters, scarves, gloves and wool caps, among other things. 

This bank member has been in the business for years, and it's going well, thanks to the efforts she puts into her business each day. She sells her merchandise to customers who request it, and to tourists. The member is a responsible and industrious person, because this is how she advances her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, including alpaca sweaters. She is grateful for the offer of a loan and promises to comply with her payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as alpaca sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa de Jesús, de 62 años de edad, es una mujer  trabajadora y dinámica, además de alegre y sociable.  Es separada del padre de sus hijos.  Es madre  soltera de 2 hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y son su inspiración para seguir trabajando. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Teresa de Jesús es venta de bebidas gasificadas y refrescos de frutas, lo cual lo realiza en un local propio acondicionado  en su propia casa, logrando ganarse muchos  clientes por su buena atención. Dedicándose al mismo tiempo a la venta de ropas de segundo uso, los cuales compras en los centros comerciales de su ciudad, para venderlos entre sus vecinas. Dedicándose a dicha actividad hace más de 02 años, lo cual lo realiza con la ayuda de su hija. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera, y poder apoyar a su familia con los gastos  de su hogar, también le gusta el tiempo libre que tiene y lo puede usar en otras actividades. 
 Por otro lado vende sus bebidas gasificadas, nos  comenta que en ésta actividad no se pierde por ser un producto de bastante consumo, en toda actividad social siempre tiene demanda, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio  y mejorar su local. Este es el préstamo número 09 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de  800 nuevo soles, los invertirá en la compra de esencias de frutas para la elaboración de sus refrescos, comprara ropas usadas, con lo restante comprara bebidas gasificadas  y así tener más acogida e ingreso económico.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús, age 62, is a hard-working and dynamic woman.  She is also cheerful and friendly.  She is separated from the father of her children.  She is the single mother of two children, whom she loves very much.  They are her inspiration to continue working.  They live together comfortably in her own house.

Teresa de Jesús sells carbonated drinks and fruit drinks.  She does this at a spot set up in her own house.  She manages to win over many customers because of her good service.  At the same time, she also sells second hand clothes that she purchases at commercial centers in her city.  She does this to sell them to her neighbors.

She has been engaged in this business activity for over two years.  Her daughter helps her.  What she likes about this business activity is the income that it generates for her.  She also likes being able to contribute to the family’s household expenses.  Additionally, she likes the free time that she has and that she is able to use it on other activities.

She comments that selling carbonated drinks is a business activity that cannot lose because it is a product that is consumed a lot.  It is always in demand at social events.  That is why she plans to make her business grow and to improve her place.

This is her ninth loan with MFP.  She is happy and grateful for the opportunity of the loan in order to be able to advance with her business.  She pledges to make her payments.  She will use the requested 800 soles to buy fruit essence to make her drinks, and she will buy used clothes.  She will use the rest to buy carbonated drinks.  This way her business will be more widely accepted, and she will have more income.

loans.use: to buy fruit, carbonated beverages, and clothes.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 52 years old, married to Hellen and blessed with children over 18 years. He sells maize, a business he started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of 50,000 KES. 

He has requested a second loan of 60,000 KES to purchase 20 bags of maize to sell. The profit he makes will help him build rental houses to boost his monthly income. 

Alexander's dream is to see this business expand to a mega business venture.

loans.use: To purchase 20 bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 40-year-old married woman who has four family members. She is from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to buy clothes to resell. She would like to expand her business by increasing her products. In the future, Dalal wants to open a big shop to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Here is Mariama, a small scale businesswoman in Kabala, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. Mariama sells food stuff – mayonnaise, cocoa, milk, etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. 

With a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones, Mariama will expand her business by buying more food stuffs like butter, margarine, mayonnaise, sugar, milk, cocoa, etc. to add to her shop. 

Mariama was born in Kenema city, in Eastern Sierra Leone, but she is currently residing in Kabala together with her husband and children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary school.

loans.use: to buy butter, margarine, mayonnaise, sugar, milk, cocoa, etc. to add to her shop.

loans.name: Rosa Didima

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín que se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y  del Ecuador.

La señora Rosa tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo el cual es mayor de edad y  aún viven en su casa. Su esposo es discapacitado.

Ella a ver que su esposo no puede trabajar por su discapacidad hace varios años atrás decidió empezar un negocio,  cría aves de corral para lo cual y con los recursos que tenia y con la ayuda de los créditos construyó un pequeña granja en la cual mete hasta 300 pollos por temporada, después de tres meses cuando los pollos tienen un peso adecuado los entrega a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa a comprarle sus pollos. Lleva más de 13 años con esta actividad y es así como ella y su familia sale adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas para los mismos. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos ella pudo empezar su actividad económica la cual les permite ganarse la vida.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Junín communal bank meets in the Junín settlement every two weeks.  This place is known for its friendly and hardworking people and because the best brandy in the province and all of Ecuador is distilled here.

Rosa is 66 years old, married and has one adult son who still lives at home.  Her husband is handicapped.
 
Several years ago, since her husband can’t work because of his handicap, she decided to start a business raising coral birds.  She used her own money and money from loans to build a chicken coup where she keeps up to 300 chickens.  After three months, when the chickens are of adequate weight, she delivers them to a supplier who visits her at home to buy the chickens.  She has been doing this for more than 13 years and this is how she and her family get ahead.
 
She will use the money from this loan to buy chickens, feed, and medicine.  She has been with the communal bank almost since the beginning and she likes it because one of the loans allowed her to start this business which allows her to make a living.
 
She hopes to be able to continue ahead and stay healthy.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 39-year-old married woman who has 3 family members, and is from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy materials for her salon; she is looking to expand. 

In the future she wants to open a big salon to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy materials for her salon.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Yerevan with his wife, son and daughter. He rents a little booth in one of Yerevan's busiest markets; he started the business in 2007. 

Armen has applied for this loan to purchase trousers and shirts for the autumn and winter seasons. This is important for Armen to attract more clients, keep developing his business and expand it in the future.

loans.use: to pay for trousers and shirts to resell.

loans.name: Kanykey

texts.ru:
Каныкей замужем, имеет 4 детей. Каныкей работает библиотекарем в местной школе  и в качестве дополнительного дохода 2 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Каныкей в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 дойные коровы с приплодом, 10 овец, ежемесячная прибыль составляет 10,000 сом. Также, Каныкей занимается пошивом и реставрацией одежды на дому, что также приносит доход в семейный бюджет. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Каныкей обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Каныкей планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы в перспективе открыть швейный цех и накопить сумму для оплаты обучения детей.
texts.en:
Kanykey is married and has four children. She works as a librarian at the local school. As an additional source of income, for two years she has been raising livestock, having launched this business  with 15,000 KGS. Thanks to Kanykey’s hard work, her farm now includes three dairy cows with their young and 10 sheep; the monthly revenues from the farm is about 10,000 KGS. Kanykey also sews and repairs clothing at home, which adds to the family budget.

In order to develop her business further, Kanykey turned to “Bai Tushum and Partners“ for a loan of 100,000 KGS intended to buy livestock for fattening and resale. Kanykey plans to use her revenues from this loan into increasing the headcount of her livestock, so that in the future she could open a sewing shop and save enough to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years old, married to Richard and blessed with children. She is a tailor. She started her business five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 5000. 

She has requested her first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase cloth materials to sell, as well as sewing threads and needles.

The profit Florence earns will be ploughed back into her business. She hopes to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials, sewing threads and needles.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther ended her education in the 10th grade.  She is single, and lives in West Point. She has been selling oranges, plums, bananas, pineapples, and lemons for the past six years; she learned to sell from her step-mother. 

Esther makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods to increase her sales and improve her life. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more oranges, bananas, lemons, pineapples, and plums for the business. 

Her future plan is to complete her education.

loans.use: to purchase more oranges, bananas, lemons, pineapples, and plums to resell.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas y pollos,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia los vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco como tambien sus clientes van a su casa a comprar a sus animales,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,a la vez la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de artesania (textiles),siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de alimentos y comprar mas pollos para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: She belongs to the “Comuzone I” communal bank and continues with her business raising small farm animals like hens and chicks.  She raises these little animals to then sell to customers that request them.  She sells them in one of Cusco’s markets as well as to customers who come by her house to buy them.  She’s been in this business for a good length of time and does well because of the effort she puts into it daily.  She also continues with her business selling crafts (textiles) since this is how she supports her family.  She’s requesting the loan to buy feed and more chicks for her business.  She is grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy more feed and chicks for the business.

loans.name: Alexander Jose

texts.es: El joven Alexander se dedica a  la venta de ropa usada hace 10 años, es casado procrearon una hija que ya tiene 5 años, este negocio lo empezó junto a su madre quien ahora vende en los departamentos, él le vende a un vecino a un precio justo con quien se apoyan mutuamente en las ventas, sus principales compradores son los pobladores de los diferentes barrios de la capital a los que les lleva el producto hasta sus casas en conjunto con su esposa, gracia a este negocio cubren con todos los gastos necesarios del hogar. Alexander está aplicando para su primer crédito con AFODENIC y KIVA, para levantar el muro perimetral de su casa para obtener mayor seguridad de su hogar y familia, por lo que necesita comprar materiales de construcción hierro, arena, 300 piedras cantera y 25 bolsas de cemento para reforzar lo poco que ya tiene de material, todo ello para levantar la obra y brindar un mejoramiento a su vivienda, que en sus planes esta el seguir construyendo hasta terminar de acondicionar su casita.
texts.en:
Alexander has been selling used clothes for 10 years.  He’s married and has a five-year-old daughter.  He started the business with his mother who now sells in the departments.  He sells to a neighbor at a fair price and they support each other with their sales.  His main buyers are residents of various neighborhoods in the capital; he and his wife take them the merchandise to their houses.  Thanks to this business they are able to cover all necessary household expenses.

Alexander is applying for his first Afodenic and Kiva loan to erect a perimeter wall at home to have more security for his home and family.  To do so, he needs to buy building materials and supplies like rebar, sand, 300 paving stones and 25 sacks of cement to add to the materials he already has.  All of this is in order to do the project and improve his home.  His plan is to continue building until his house is completely done.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of two additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last three years. Jane earns additional income by selling fried cassava and chapatti at school. She works seven days a week.  

Jane has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are ever-increasing prices of used clothes and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 39 years old.  She works as a bank agent, where customers can withdraw as well as deposit cash. Customers can also pay bills, open accounts, and view account balances. She is married to Titus, and has four children.

This is her first loan and she plans to use the amount to add float to her business. Float is electronic credits purchased for resale in a mobile money business. 

She hopes to grow her business and offer more services, to increase her income, and to educate her children.

loans.use: to add float (electronic credits) to sell in her mobile money business.

loans.name: Erkinoy

texts.ru: Женщина с добрым сердцем и прекрасной душой, которую зовут Еркиной, хочет организовать свой бизнес. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации  и получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Еркиной на воспитании имеет 3 детей и должна купить новые технологии для них. С целью организовать свой бизнес, она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес изготовлением и продажи печения, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки духовки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A woman with a kind heart and beautiful soul, whose name is Erkinoy, wants to set up her own business. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation and makes a small salary. His wages are not enough to provide the family with all the necessities. Erkinoy has 3 children at home and needs to buy the latest technology for them. For the purpose of establishing her own business, she took a course entitled "To Get Ahead" that was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she received a certificate. She wants to establish a business in baking and selling cookies because she is experienced in this area. Erkinoy is seeking a loan in the amount of 500 Tajikistan Somoni to buy an oven to get her business started. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy an oven to set up a new business

loans.name: Adjeiley Ja Adam

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Adjeiley JA Adam est une  femme  célibataire qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce et de la couture depuis plus de 10ans.  Elle pratique la vente de tissus et bijoux et les revenus qu’elle gagne lui permettent de prendre en charge ses frais de loyer (domicile et magasin ou elle exerce son activité), ses factures d’électricité et la dépense quotidienne pour se nourrir. Elle consacre 10 heures de temps de la journée a son activité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC situé dans sa zone d’habitation. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et de bijoux a commercialiser. Son objectif consiste a mieux développer son activité, accroitre ses bénéfices et améliorer le niveau de son épargne.  Son vœu futur est d’ouvrir un atelier de couture.
texts.en:
Adjeiley Ja Adam is single and lives in Senegal. 

Adjeiley Ja Adam has been involved in the dressmaking business for more than 10 years. She sells fabrics and jewellery, and the money she earns enables her to pay her rent (on her house and the shop where she runs her business), electricity bills and daily food costs. She works at her business for 10 hours a day. 

Adjeiley Ja Adam is a member of one of the local UIMCEC branches in her area and she is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs to purchase fabrics and jewellery to sell. Her aim is to develop her business, increase her profits and add to her savings. Her ambition for the future is to open a sewing shop.

loans.use: buy fabrics and jewellery to resell.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou est une femme mariée qui habite au Sénégal. Elle évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente d’habits  et de chaussures.  Elle consacre journalière ment  8 heures de temps de la journée à son activité. Les revenus que lui procure son commerce li permettent de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et en meme temps de gérer la dépense quotidienne de sa petite famille. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits et de chaussures destinés à la vente. Elle souhaite renforcer d’avantage son fond de roulement dans le but de d’acheter de nouveaux tissus ce que lui permettra de diversifier la gamme de tissus qu’elle commercialise en vue d’augmenter ses bénéfices, d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille et d’épargner de l’argent. Son projet futur est de disposer d’une boutique ou elle pourra exposer ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Aissatou is married and lives in Senegal. 

For more than 10 years, Aissatou has been building up a business selling clothing and shoes. She works at her business for 8 hours a day and the income from her business allows her to pay her children’s school fees and meet her small family’s daily expenses. 

Aissatou is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs to purchase clothing and shoes to resell. She would like to increase her working capital so that she can buy new fabrics in order to diversify the products she sells. This will allow her to increase her profits, better feed her family and save money. 

In the future, she would like to have a shop where she could display her products.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de ropa como casacas,pantalones,jeans entre otros,la socia viaja cada cierto tiempo a la ciudad de Lima para comprar su mercaderia para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades y clientes,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de chompas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: She belongs to the “Comuzone I” communal bank and continues with her business buying and selling clothes like jackets, pants and jeans, among others.  She goes to Lima every so often to buy her merchandise to then resell to customers that request it as well as to friends and customers.  She’s been in business for a good length of time and does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into it.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person and this is how she supports her family.  She requests the loan to buy sweaters for her business.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy sweaters.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Del Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina Margod ella es casada y tiene 44 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia realiza trabajos de bordados, ella borda trajes típicos entre otros adornos, la socia trabaja a pedidos desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia tiene 6 años en este negocio y quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y que estos sean profesionales, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanías. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar hilos de colores, telas y agujas al por  mayor para que haga sus trabajos de bordados.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de fruta y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  Dina Margod, 44, is one of the members.  She’s married and has three children and works selling crafts.  She does embroidery work; she embroiders traditional outfits among other decorations.  She works on order from 8am until 6pm and has been in business six years.  She wants to raise her children and that they become professionals.  Her dream is to expand the crafts sales.  She’s requesting the loan to buy thread in assorted colors, fabric and needles at wholesale to do her embroidery work.  She is grateful to all those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

The member appearing in the inserted photo asked permission because of work and her photo was taken after the group photo.  The other members work selling food, clothes, fruit and run a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy thread in assorted colors, fabric and needles at wholesale for her embroidery.

loans.name: Eliab

texts.en:
Eliab is a 32-year-old married man with two children who all attend school.  He has been operating his cattle-fattening business for four years now.

Alongside selling cows for meat, Eliab also milks his cows and sells the milk to his clients. The reason why Eliab started his business was to start paying for school fees for his children. He hopes to be able to buy much more land in the future to provide more grazing land for his cows. As you can see from the picture, his cows are quite photogenic.

loans.use: To buy some skinny cows

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 39 years old, married to John, and blessed with three children aged 12, 6 and 1. She owns a retail shop, a business she started a year ago which earns her a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Tabitha is requesting her second loan of KES 40,000 to purchase bales of baking flour, sugar, spices and bars of soap. Her profits will aid her in paying school fees for her children.

Tabitha's dream for the future is to venture into other forms of business to earn additional income and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase bales of baking flour, sugar, spices and bars of soap.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. She has no additional family members. 

She operates a beauty salon, and also sells second-hand clothes at the market. She sells her products on retail basis. She has been in business for the last 7 years, and works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy braids, hair treatments, weaves and a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. She lives in rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy braids, hair treatments, weaves and a bale of used clothes for her businesses.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua con su negocio de peluqueria,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia cuenta con un local donde realiza todo tipo de cortes,peinados,teñido,manicure entre otros a sus clientes que le solicitan de acuerdo a los distintos compromisos que puedan tener como matrimonios,fiestas de 15 años entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de tintes,shampus y tijeras nuevas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank COMUZONE I.  She continues to run her hairdressing business.  She has been doing this for years and it has been going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  

The member has a place where she offers her clients every type of cut, hairstyle, hair color, manicure, etc., depending on the distinct needs of the event, including weddings and birthdays for 15-year-olds (a celebration like "sweet 16").  The member is responsible and earnest, which helps her family get ahead.

The member is asking for the loan to buy dyes, shampoo and new scissors.  She feels grateful for the loans bestowed on her and she is committed to paying them back.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo and new scissors.

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín que se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y  del Ecuador.

La señora María tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijos de 18, 17, y 13  años de edad que estudian en colegio. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha ayudado en su negocio y le ha permitido sacar sola adelante a sus hijos.

Para salir adelante ella con sus hijos hicieron unos corrales en los cuales se dedican a la cría de chanchos y aves de corral, ella compra los chanchos cuando están pequeños, los alimenta por unos tres a cuatro meses y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta la zona a comprar estos animalitos, lleva más de 8 años con esta actividad la misma que le permite salir adelante honradamente.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su vida. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Junín communal bank meets in the Junín settlement every two weeks.  This place is known for its friendly and hardworking people and because the best brandy in the province and all of Ecuador is distilled here.
