María is 34 years old and is the single mother of three children, ages 18, 17, and 13.  They all attend school.  She’s been with the communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because the loans have helped her business greatly and has allowed her to get ahead with her children.
 
In order to get ahead, she and her children built some pens where they raise pigs and coral birds.  She buys the pigs when they are small, raises them for three or four months, and then sells them to merchants who visit the zone to buy these animals.  She’s been doing this for more than eight years and it allows her to earn an honest living.
 
She will use the money from this loan to buy chickens and also feed and medicine for the chickens and pigs.  She has been with the communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because the loans help her greatly in her life.

Her dreams are to continue getting ahead and to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David used his previous loan amount to buy fertilizer and pesticides. It was profitable, and he was able to pay off the loan amount.

Besides farming, he also works as an agent and offers money transfer services, where clients can send and withdraw money. He also sells phones and phone accessories.

This being his fourth loan, he plans to use the amount to add business float (electronic credits to sell) to his money transfer business(M-pesa). With the anticipated profits, he will buy more phones and phone accessories to sell. 

David hopes to grow his money transfer business by opening more of them in different places.

loans.use: to add float - electronic credits purchased for resale in a mobile money business.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is 41 years old, married and the father of four children. For the last five years, he has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000, to buy milk cans and milking gloves. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as expand his farming activities. 

His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing his income so as to help improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy milk cans and milking gloves

loans.name: Mizraim Frecia

texts.es:
La socia es la señorita Frecia, soltera con 19 años de edad, ella se dedica  a la venta de productos y complementos nutricionales naturales, actividad que viene realizando hace algún tiempo para ayudar en los gastos de su casa y a sus padres.
Frecia está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su actividad  y comprar más mercadería para cubrir su mercado y las solicitudes de sus clientes;  por ello La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla en el fortalecimiento y crecimiento de su actividad y por permitirle ayudar a su familia, además ella quiere ahorrar para estudiar una carrera universitaria a mediano plazo para procurarse un mejor porvenir. Frecia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Frecia, 19, is single and works selling natural nutritional supplements and products, an activity she’s been in for some time now to help her parents with household expenses.  She’s asking for the loan to capitalize her business and buy more merchandise to satisfy market and customer demand.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her strengthen and expand her activity and for making it possible for her to help her family.  She wants to save in order to attend university in the medium run to attain a better future.  Frecia is a member of the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy nutritional supplements.

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
La SeñoraMaría conforma el banco comunal San Vicente hace 5 años, tiempo en el que ha estrechado lazos de amistad con todas sus compañeras, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió que tiene grandes llanuras y hermosos paisajes, este lugar es propicio para la crianza de ganado, su gente también se dedica a la agricultura y muchos salen diariamente  a la ciudad a ejercer diferentes actividades económicas.

La Señora. María es muy joven tiene 28 años de edad y es madre soltera de una hija que tiene 10 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la comunidad, vive con su padre con quien comparte los gastos de su hogar, la casa es de propiedad de su padre.
 
Ella trabaja desde su casa, se dedica al bordado artesanal, para aprender esta actividad la inicio trabajando y gracias a su habilidad ahora es toda una profesional, encontrándose en el negocio hace 8 años, trabaja sin horario ni día fijo. También se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, pollos y ganado a los que los vende en su comunidad,  siembra varios productos pero solo para el consumo de su hogar.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos y alimento para animales.
 
Su  meta es que su hija llegue a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
María has been a part of the San Vicente communal bank for the past five years, during which she has established friendly ties with all of her coworkers.  She lives on the outskirts of the Victoria del Portete parish in Cuenca, a place with a cold climate that has great plains and beautiful landscapes.  This area is favorable for raising livestock.  The people here also farm and many travel to the city to work.
 
María is very young, 28 years old, and the single mother of a ten year old daughter who attends the community school.  She lives with her father with whom she shares the household expenses.  The house is her father’s.

She works from her home and does artistic knitting.  She learned to do this by working at it and thanks to her talent she now does this professionally, having been doing this for eight years.  She doesn’t have a fixed schedule.  She also raises Guinea pigs, chickens, and livestock, which she sells in the community.  She raises various crops but only for her personal household consumption.

She will invest the money from this loan to buy Guinea pigs, chickens, and feed.

Her goal is for her daughter to become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs, chickens, and feed.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 27-year-old married man with 1 child. He is a farmer, and deals in coffee-growing. He started the business in 2007. 

James can produce 700 kilograms of coffee every season. Through the income earned from coffee sales, he has managed to buy a piece of land for coffee-growing, and has been able to support his family with the basic necessities. 

He wants a loan of 1,000,000 shillings to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee, which will enable him realize high returns due to increased yield. 

His dream is to be the leading producer of coffee in his region. His challenge is poor transportation of coffee from the field to the market. He is a honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Kevin sells soft drinks, beer, and local brew in a bar that she rents. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy crates of soda, beer, passion fruits, pineapple and a jerrican of local brew. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked pub and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer, soda, pineapples and jerricans of local brew.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat lives in Yerevan with his wife and 1-year-old son. About 5 months ago, Ararat started his own business of making ornaments from gold. Ararat sells the ornaments to local traders. During this short period, Ararat has received an increased number of orders, and now needs to buy gold to complete them. 
Ararat dreams of expanding his business, which will allow him to hire employees and start making a large variety of gold products. Further developing his business will help him achieve this goal.

loans.use: to buy gold to fulfill his customers' orders.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a beauty salon at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy braids, hair treatments, weaves and hair sprays. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own two hand dryers so as to serve her customers better. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more braids, hair treatments, weaves and hair sprays

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is forty-nine years old and lives with her grown up son. She owns a rental house, which is her only source of income and sustenance. Recently, the roof of her rental house was damaged. With the rainy season approaching, Mary needs to have her roof repaired to ensure the comfort and safety of her tenants. Mary needs to buy materials but does not have enough money, so she is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy new iron sheets and lumber. Mary has good credit references and is very responsible. She is sure she will succeed in repaying her loan and grant her son the economic security he deserves.

loans.use: to buy new iron sheets and lumber to repair her roof.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: El Señor Rosendo tiene 57 años, es un hombre viudo; vive en su propia casa junto a su única hija Avelina de 29 años. Rosendo se dedica al cultivo y producción de cacao y café; lo realiza en su parcela hace 23 años; en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros de esa manera logran terminar la cosecha de manera rápida. Para el sus cultivos es importante, ya que gracias a ello obtuvo su vivienda. Cuando es tiempo de venderlos lo hace en el centro de acopio de su comunidad, donde le pagan un buen precio. Sus planes para el futuro son de ampliar su parcela y mejorar su estabilidad económica, para eso mencionan que comprara más tierras. Este es su crédito número 05; asegura seguir cumpliendo lo pagos en sus respectivas fechas, le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal porque entre ellos existe el apoyo moral y económico. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, más sus ganancias realizará la compra de un terreno, para cultivar plantas de café.
texts.en:
Rosendo is 57 years old.  He is a widower who lives in his own home with his only daughter, Avelina, who is 29 years old.  Rosendo makes his living with the cultivation and production of cocoa and coffee.  He has been doing this on his parcel of land for 23 years.  During the harvest, he gets help from laborers, which enables him to harvest his crops quickly.  His crops are important to him, since they are the reason he was able to get his apartment.

When the time comes to sell his crops, he goes to the central gathering place in his community, where his customers pay him a good price.  His plans for the future are to enlarge his parcel of land and improve his financial stability.  To accomplish this, he will buy more land.

This is loan number 5.  He is confident that he will continue to complete his payments by their respective dates.  He enjoys working with the communal bank because of the moral and financial support he receives.  With the 1,500 nuevos soles (Peruvian monetary units), together with his earnings, he will buy a piece of land to plant coffee.

loans.use: to buy agricultural land.

loans.name: María Judith

texts.es:
La Señora. María hace 3 años forma parte del banco comunal San Vicente, gracias al banco comunal ha estrechado lazos de amistad con todas sus compañeras, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió que tiene grandes llanuras y hermosos paisajes, este lugar es propicio para la crianza de ganado, su gente también se dedica a la agricultura y muchos salen diariamente  a la ciudad a ejercer diferentes actividades económicas.

Doña María tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, 4 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, sus cuatro hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. Su esposo trabaja como estibador, la casa en la que viven es herencia de sus padres.
 
Ella pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa dedicándose a la crianza de animales como son cuyes, gallinas, borregos y ganado, la leche que obtiene de su ganado la vende. También trabaja en la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus potreros y alimento para sus animales.
 
Su sueño es de seguir conservando su salud y crecer en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
María has been a part of the San Vicente communal bank for the past three years, during which she has established friendly ties with all of her coworkers.  She lives on the outskirts of the Victoria del Portete parish in Cuenca, a place with a cold climate that has great plains and beautiful landscapes.  This area is favorable for raising livestock.  The people here also farm and many travel to the city to work.

María is 60 years old, married, and has eight adult children.  Four of them are married and live on their own.  Her four single children help her financially.  Her husband works as a stevedore.  They inherited their house from her parents. 

She spends most of her time at home raising animals, such as Guinea pigs, chickens, sheep, and livestock.  She sells the milk she gets from her livestock.  She also farms but her crops are only for personal consumption.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer for her crops and feed for her animals.

Her dream is to stay healthy and grow her animal business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy essentials such as flour, sugar, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is happy for the financial support she get from Kiva and Yehu. This is her fifth loan from Yehu, and she says that they have been beneficial to her. Amina says that her store is growing and she aims to expand it and own a wholesale business in the future. 

Amina is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. She plans to add stock of rice, sugar, soft drinks, flour, etc. These are some of the things she has noticed are selling the most and the neighborhood cannot do without them. Amina is sure to have good income out of this investment.

loans.use: to add stock of rice, sugar, soft drinks, flour, etc., to her store

loans.name: Heydi Isabel

texts.es: La sra. Heydide 27 años de edad, es casada, tanto ella como su esposo trabajan en el comercio de celulares desde hace 2 años, salen a vender a lugares como San Pedro, La Libertad, La Gateada y los Chinamos, de los ingresos de su negocio depende la manutencion de su economia familiar. Ella inicio su negocio con un dinero que le facilito su papa y de ahi ha logrado mantener y superar su negocio. Solicita este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia porque sus clientes les  solicitan otros modelos de celulares que ella no tiene en inventario, al crecer su negocio mejoraran sus ingresos mensuales lo que le permitira mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Heydi, 27, is married.  She and her husband have been working as mobile phone merchants for the last two years.  They go out to sell in places like San Pedro, La Libertad, La Gateada and Los Chinamos.  Their family’s food and family income depends on what they earn in their business.  She started it with some money her father gave her and from then has managed to stay in business and improve it.  She’s requesting this loan to buy merchandise like other mobile phone models she does not have in inventory her customers are requesting.  As her business grows, so will her monthly income which will lead to improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Wiñay Huayna Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WIÑAY HUAYNA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoila ella es casada y tiene 62 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de huevos sancochados con papas, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, y por medio de este negocio la socia paga el estudio de su hijo que está en la universidad, la socia se dedica a  este negocio 18 años y le va bien pero su sueño de la socia es poder tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar huevos y papas al por mayor para su negocio de venta de huevos sancochados.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de tejidos, negocio de venta de mochilas, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Wiñay Huayna” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  One of them is Zoila, 62.  She’s married and has a son.  She works in her business selling hard-boiled eggs and potatoes.  She sells from place to place in various streets in Cusco from 8am until 4pm and is able to pay her son’s university expenses by means of this business.  She’s been in business for 18 years and does well but her dream is to own a restaurant.  She’s requesting the loan to buy eggs and potatoes at wholesale for her hard-boiled eggs and potatoes business.  She thanks all those who are sharing in her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

The inserted photo was taken after the group photo because the member asked permission due to work.  The other group members work weaving fabric, selling backpacks, groceries and clothes.

loans.use: to buy eggs and potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Osman.  He is married, and has 2 children, ages 7 and 6. He has no additional dependents.  

In 1998, Osman established his mobile phone and accessories business. He began his business after the death of his father, who had been supporting him fully in his schooling. He tried to continue schooling, but was not easy. He was left with no other alternative but to enter into business with friends.

He started as a sales assistant, until he secured a small fund and established his own business. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,350,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Osman has already received and successfully repaid his first loan. He now requires a new loan in order to buy mobile phones worth Le 4,000,000.  The balance of Le 1,000,000 will be used to buy mobile accessories. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 850,000. 

In the future, Osman plans to open a big shop so that he could be a supplier of mobile phones. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones worth Le 4,000,000 with the balance of Le 1,000,000 to buy mobile accessories to resell.

loans.name: Azniv

texts.en:
Azniv lives in Vostan village, Ararat region, with her husband and parents-in-law. Together with the family, Azniv is involved in agriculture.  They raise cows, hens, and turkeys, cultivate tomatoes, and grow fruit trees. 

Azniv and her husband, Edvard, want to construct a new barn for the livestock, as their barn is old and does not have the necessary conditions for the cattle. The couple also wants to increase the number of cattle, so they need a bigger barn. 

This loan will allow Azniv to cover construction costs of the new barn. In addition, Azniv would like to purchase fertilizer for land cultivation and forage to feed the cattle.

loans.use: to pay for forage (plant material eaten by grazing livestock), fertilizer, and construction of a new barn.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in Ararat village with her husband and 3 sons. The family runs a farm, where they cultivate tomatoes, peppers, eggplant, watermelon and keep a grape orchard. Alvard would like to buy new poles and stakes for the grape orchard, which will allow her to develop the orchard and grow more grapes there. She also needs sufficient funds for the cultivation of vegetables. In particular, she plans to buy fertilizer, fuel for the harvest transportation and pay for watering the land. 

Agricultural income is important for Alvard to sustain her family. She dreams of her sons starting their own families and living a prosperous life. Development of farming will allow Alvard to help her sons and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, poles, stakes, fuel and watering the land

loans.name: Samini

texts.en:
Samini is in sales. He has a small grocery store which is well stocked. It's been about five years since he got into this business, so he has a good customer base and much experience in the industry. He started with capital that he had saved doing casual jobs, and at the first opportunity he opened his business with his wife. Together they live with their son, who is still young.

Samini is requesting this loan to buy basic necessity items to stock his store, such as foodstuffs and soft drinks. He appreciates the confidence and opportunity to get ahead that he has received, and he says that he won't disappoint.

loans.use: to stock his store with foodstuffs, soft drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari lives with his wife in a very humble abode of his own. He is an enterprising person who very much wants to get ahead. Bakari is a tailor; he has run this business for over ten years. He’s well known in the area where he lives for being very cheerful, optimistic and hardworking.

He is asking for this loan to invest in his business. He plans to purchase a motorcycle taxi with 40,000 KES. He will use the other 10,000 KES to buy sewing materials, such as fabric at cost, needles and some spare parts like bobbins and blades, in order to fine-tune his work and thus get ahead as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle taxi and sewing materials.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 44 años de edad, esta casada con Hugo de 44 años; juntos habitan en su propia casa que compraron gracias  a sus esfuerzos; tienen 05 hijos a quienes brinda una buena educación para que tengan un buen futuro.
Victoria, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (cereales, verduras, conservas, bebidas, dulces, etc.); esta labor viene realizando hace 08 años con el apoyo de su esposo. Para ella su trabajo es rentable, ya que siempre cuenta con ingresos económicos gracias a los pobladores de su comunidad; sin embargo hay días en que se dificulta como los días en mayor clientela hay, ya que no puede atenderlos de manera rápida; es ahí donde su esposo o hijos le apoyan en su trabajo.
Con el préstamo que obtuvo se abastecerá de mercadería para la mejora de su negocio y de esa manera mejora su calidad de vida. Este es su crédito número 06; una vez más agradece a los financieros por la confianza que le dan, ya que gracias a su apoyo va mejorando su negocio. en su banco comunal, es una socia reservada y responsable. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles, comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar, bebidas y verduras
texts.en:
Victoria, 44, is married to Hugo, 44, and they live together in their own house that they bought with much effort.  They have five children she’s providing a good education for so that they will have a good future.

Victoria sells groceries (cereals, vegetables, canned goods, beverages, candy, etc.)  She’s been doing this work for 8 years with support from her husband.  For her, the business is profitable because she always has income thanks to her community’s residents.  However, there are days when she has difficulties like days when she has too many customers and she can’t take care of them quickly enough; that’s when her husband or her children step in to help her with the work.

She will use the loan she got to stock up on merchandise to improve the business and thus her quality of life.  This is her sixth loan and once again she thanks lenders for the trust they place in her.  Thanks to their support her business is improving.  She is a reserved, responsible member of her communal bank.  She will use the 2,500 new soles to buy sacks of rice, sugar, beverages and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, beverages and vegetables.

loans.name: María Yaqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y  del Ecuador.

La señora María tiene 42 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad y tres de 14, 10 y 6 años de edad, los tres menores estudian en colegio y escuela. 

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante sola con sus hijos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon, Esika y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva 14 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Junín” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Junín Canton, a place noted for its kind, hardworking people and because the best ‘aguardiente’ [liquor] in the province and in all Ecuador is distilled here.

María, 42, is divorced and has four children.   One of them is an adult and the other three are 14, 10 and 6 years old; they attend secondary and elementary school.

She is a housewife who in order to earn her own income to be able to raise her children alone, sells Avon, Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door and works three days a week from two to three hours daily.  She sells on credit and collects payment weekly.  She’s been doing this for more than 10 years and does very well.  What she sells most is perfume and cosmetics because they are very good.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics, among other things she sells.  She’s been in the communal bank for 14 years and likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dream is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 45, lives with his wife and their two children. He sells clothes for men and women from his small store on one of the busy streets of the city. He has been doing this for four years, and it has given him a lot of sales experience. He's well known in his town because aside from being a good salesman, he's also honest, friendly and kind to people. He has a lot of customers who recommend him because he has the best quality products at good prices, but above all because of his excellent service. 

Peter is a determined man with a great desire to get ahead. He works hard and puts his heart into it because he knows that only through effort and motivation will he achieve the success he desires.

Like all good merchants, now that demand has increased he wants to take advantage and invest again. For that reason, he asks Yehu for a loan that will allow him to buy bales of clothes in bulk. 

Peter has good credit references and is certain he can pay back his debt, as well as being confident that he will be able to give his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Geiter

texts.es:
Geiter, de 56 años de edad, es un hombre amable y emprendedor. Es separado de la madre de sus hijos. Vive solo  en  un cuarto alquilado, pero mensualmente pasa la pensión para sus hijos menores. La actividad que realiza Geiter, es labor de transporte de pasajeros en la ciudad, para eso cuenta con su trimovil conocido como mototaxi, siendo su herramienta de trabajo y fuente de sustento.  Le gusta su trabajo  y decidió iniciarse hace más de 8  años, viendo que esa actividad que había perdido su empleo en una compañía, u necesitando un fuente de ingreso económico, se decidió por éste oficio. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene.
Le gusta  su actividad pues le permite tener ingresos económicos sustanciales para pagar los gastos propios de su hogar y darse una mejor calidad de vida. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad tenía problemas económicos, ya que había perdido su empleo.
Espera seguir creciendo, esta actividad  siempre tiene demanda, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio. Este es el préstamo número 9 con la institución MFP, se siente contento de contar con el apoyo de un crédito para avanzar con su negocio, por eso asegura será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además de sentirse muy cómodo con su grupo, ya que los considera buenas personas y muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevo soles, lo invertirá en la compra de repuesto para su trimovil , y así mantener en buen estado su trimovil y tener mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Geiter is 56 years old.  He is a friendly and entrepreneural man.  He is separated from the mother of his children.  He lives alone in a rented room, but he pays child support monthly for his children who are still minors.  Geiter makes a living transporting passengers in the city, so he relies on his motorized rickshaw (known as a mototaxi), which serves as the source of his income.

He enjoys his job and decided to start his business more than 8 years ago, when he lost his job at a company and needed a source of income.  He considers his business profitable due to the good earnings it allows and the demand.  He also likes the activity because it allows him to have substantial income to pay his own household expenses and gives him a better quality of life.  Before he started this business he had financial problems due to the loss of his job.  He hopes to continue growing.  There is always demand for this service, so he has plans to increase his business.

This is loan number 9 with MFP and he feels like he can count on the support of a loan to advance his business.  He assures us that he will be punctual in paying off his loans.  He also feels very comfortable with his group, as he considers them to be good people with solidarity among them.  With the amount he is asking (1500 nuevos soles), he will invest in the purchase of replacement parts for his mototaxi, and in that way maintain his vehicle well and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Athar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Athar, which consists of three women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan for 210,000 YER from AMB. 

Zabiba is the leader of this group. She is 38 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in a rented house. She will use her portion of the loan (70,000 YER)  to buy a blanket for her bedroom. In the future, she hopes to have a house.

loans.use: to buy blanket for her bedroom.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de ser alegre y amable. Es separada del padre de sus 4 hijos Casandra de 17 años, Luís  de 14 años, Pablo de 10  años y Sandy de 19 años de edad. Juntos habitan su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Marina es la venta de ropas de segundo uso para damas, caballeros y niños de diversos modelos que  son adquiridos en la capital en cantidades, gracias al apoyo de su amiga quien vive allá, quien le realiza las compras y se las envía y luego Marina las vende entre sus amistades y vecinos, a quines atiende de manera amable, logrando ganarse su preferencia. Lleva más de 02 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento le apoya madre en búsqueda de nuevos clientes. Considera su negocio bastante rentable ya que estas prendas se compran a precios muy bajos dejándole buenas ganancias. Antes de iniciar con este negocio tenia muchos problemas económicos.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y tener una ocupación, además de estar en casa y el tiempo libre que lo emplea en le cuidado de sus hijos, y por tanto desea aumentar su stock de mercaderías, así lograra hacer crecer su negocio. Este es préstamo número 02  con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de un mayor numero de ropas de segundo uso, para tener un stock disponible para la venta, por lo que espera conseguirlos a menos precios por su compra en mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Marina, 42, is a hardworking, determined woman in addition to being cheerful and kind.  She’s separated from the father of her four children: Casandra, 17, Luís, 14, Pablo, 10, and Sandy, 19.  They live together in the house she bought with much effort.  

Marina’s activity is selling second-hand clothes for women, men and children in various styles that she buys in quantity in the capital thanks to help from a girlfriend who lives there and does the purchases and then sends Marina the goods that she sells among her friends and neighbors who she tends to kindly thus winning over their preference.

She’s been in this business for more than 2 years and to date her mother helps her in the search for new customers.  She considers the business to be profitable because these clothes are bought for very low prices so her profits are good.  Before starting this business she had many economic problems.

She enjoys her business because it generates income and she has an occupation while being able to stay home and use her free time to care for her children.  She wants to increase her stock of merchandise to make the business grow.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s hoping for your collaboration so that she can make her plans reality.  She also comments that she feels good in the communal bank because she considers her fellow members to be responsible and supportive people.

She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy a larger amount of second-hand clothes to have stock available to sell.  She hopes to get them at lower prices by purchasing them in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: Al-Amal Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Amal, which consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen.  Qlama is 24 years old and engaged. She would like to complete furnishing her bedroom  and is requesting a youth loan from AMB to help her purchase a cupboard for her bedroom. This purchase will improve her living conditions in the house.

loans.use: to purchase a cupboard for her bedroom.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora. María forma parte del banco San Vicente hace 5 años, le gusta mucho realizar los créditos en el grupo ya que son rápidos y comparte con sus amigas momentos muy gratos, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió que tiene grandes llanuras y hermosos paisajes, este lugar es propicio para la crianza de ganado, su gente también se dedica a la agricultura y muchos salen diariamente  a la ciudad a ejercer diferentes actividades económicas.

La Señora. Clementina tiene 67 años de edad, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, casados y independientes, ahora solo vive en compañía de 2 nietos que son mayores de edad y trabajan, y un nieto de 7 años que estudiando en una escuelita de la comunidad, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad. 

La Señora Clementina se dedica a la agricultura y lo que produce es solo para el consumo de su hogar, también se dedica en la crianza de animales como cuyes, gallinas y ganado que vende en su comunidad.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, alimento para sus animales y abono para sus cultivos para seguir en esta actividad económica. 

Su meta es tener más ganado y de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Clementina has been a part of the San Vicente communal bank for the past three years, during which she has established friendly ties with all of her coworkers.  She lives on the outskirts of the Victoria del Portete parish in Cuenca, a place with a cold climate that has great plains and beautiful landscapes.  This area is favorable for raising livestock.  The people here also farm and many travel to the city to work.

Clementina is 67 years old.  She’s a widow and has seven adult children, all married and on their own.  Now she only lives with two of her adult grandchildren who work, and one seven year old grandson who attends the community school.  She owns her home.

Clementina farms, but only for personal consumption.  She also raises animals, such as Guinea pigs, chickens, and livestock which she sells in the community.
 
She will use the money from this loan to buy chickens and feed for her animals, also fertilizer for her crops so that she can continue with her business.

Her goal is to have more and better quality livestock.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sumac Tica Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal SUMAC TICA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Urubamba  en la provincia de Urubamba departamento de Cusco.

La socia Raymunda, la socia tiene 67 años de edad, casada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha de jora y cerveza ,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio,su local se encuentra ubicado en su casa, la socia a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes ,la socia cría a estos animalitos para la luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de cerveza para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, venta de comida, elaboración de chicha, crianza de animales, venta de helados, venta de leña.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Raymunda, 67, is a member of the “Sumac Tica” communal bank located in Urubamba District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  She’s married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with selling ‘chicha de jora’ [type of corn beer] and beer.  She’s been in business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  Her shop is located at home and she also works raising small farm animals like guinea pigs; she raises them to then sell to customers that request them.  She is a responsible, dedicated person who supports her family this way.  She requested the loan to buy beer for her business.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

The other group members sell vegetables, food, make ‘chicha,’ raise animals, sell, ice-cream and sell firewood.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is 46 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 28, 25 and 15.  

In 2008, Gita established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her grocery store business.  

In the future, Gita plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Paraiso Perdido - Izcuchaca Group

texts.es:
¡Muy buenas tardes! El grupo “Paraíso Perdido- Izcuchaca” es un grupo que está iniciando su cuarto ciclo, conformado por 7 socios que ya llevan 18 meses  trabajando con Edaprospo.

Una de las socias de este grupo es Daría, que se dedica a la venta de comida de manera ambulatoria en las ferias y mercados de su localidad. Daría vende exclusivamente “Chicharrones” (carne de cerdo frita, muchísimo apreciada en Perú).

Daría tiene 65 años de edad, y como quedó viuda hace 3 años, los ingresos que le genera este negocio son sus únicos ingresos.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de carne de cerdo, que será utilizada en la preparación del plato que ella vende.

El sueño que ella tiene es que con el tiempo pueda tener su propio restaurante y darle una buen servicio a sus clientes.

Todo el grupo “Paraíso Perdido – Izcuchaca” está profundamente agradecido por la ayuda que personas de otros países le brindan. Daría es la señora en la izquierda, que habla en el vídeo.
texts.en:
Good Afternoon!

The “Paraíso Perdido- Izcuchaca” group is starting its fourth cycle with seven members who have been working with Edaprospo for 18 months now.  One of the group members is Daría who works selling food from place to place in local markets and street fairs.  She exclusively sells ‘chicharrones’ (fried pork that’s highly prized in Peru).  Daría is 65-years-old and was widowed three years ago.  Income from this business is her only income.  The requested loan is to buy pork that will be used to make the dish she sells.  Her dream is that in time she will be able to open her own restaurant and give good customer service.  The entire “Paraíso Perdido- Izcuchaca” group is profoundly grateful for the help people in other countries provide them with.  Daría is the lady on the left who speaks in the video.

loans.use: to buy pork to make 'chicharrones.'

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y con deseos de superación, también es amable y cordial.  Es conviviente con Odilo  quien es empleado.  Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos, su abuelo y su pareja, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa, la cual construyó con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Damaris es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comprar una maquina de coser  y una máquina remalladora con sus ahorros, la cual instaló en su propia casa,  donde atiende a sus clientes quienes la buscan por sus buenos acabados, logrando ganarse  su aceptación y así la recomiendan con otras personas que luego se vuelven en sus clientes habituales. Se inicio hace 01 año   en éste negocio, realizándolo ella sola. Considera rentable su actividad por las ganancias que le deja y así poder apoyar a su pareja.
Le gusta la costura por el oficio y ocupación que le brinda, que le valió para apoyar a su pareja a solventar los gastos de su hogar. Pero comenta le incomoda un poco el cansancio físico por estar sentada en una misma postura que le ocasiona dolores de espalda, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajando y esforzándose. Por tanto tiene  planes de ampliar su negocio y comprarse otras maquinas de coser para poder tener un mejor acabo en su costura. Este es el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, los invertirá comprar materiales de costura como telas, hilos, botones  y otros al por mayor y con lo restante lo invertirá para el mantenimiento de sus maquinas.
texts.en:
Damaris is 31 years old.  She is cheerful, with the desire to excel.  She is also friendly.  She is married to Odilo, who is employed.  She lives with her two children, her grandfather and her husband in her own home, which is comfortable and which she built with much effort.

Demaris makes a living sewing, which she learned at a trade school.  Later, she bought a sewing machine and a serger with her savings and installed them in her own house, where she attends to her clients who come to her for her good work.  Her reputation has gained her acceptance and recommendations to others who then become regular customers.

She started this business, where she is the only employee, one year ago.  She considers this activity profitable due to the earnings that it allows her. In this way, she can support her husband.  She enjoys sewing for the trade skill it offers her and for the support she can provide her husband toward paying off household expenses.  She does comment regarding the mild discomfort and fatigue due to sitting in the same position which results in back pain, but this does not discourage her and she continues working and putting in effort.  She has plans to increase her business and buy other sewing machines so she can achieve better results from her sewing.  

This is loan number two with MFP.  She is hoping for their collaboration so she can solidify her plans.  She is committed to completing the payments of her loans.  With the amount she is asking (800 nuevos soles), she will invest in the purchase of sewing materials such as fabrics, threads, buttons and other items from wholesalers.  She will invest any remaining money in the maintenance of her machines.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons and pay for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora, de 62 años, es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y desde joven muy trabajador, es incesante en su labor diaria y siempre tiene motivos por los cuales sigue adelante, es viuda desde hace muchos años, pero fruto de su amor tiene 5 hijos, vive en su casa propia junto a dos nietos de 19 y 11 años respectivamente a quienes cría desde muy pequeños y es por ellos por quienes se esfuerza día a día para salir adelante. La actividad que realiza Flora es la venta de golosinas. Ella tiene un tablero en el que coloca diariamente todo tipo de golosinas como chocolates, galletas, caramelos, chicles y distintos bocaditos. Trabaja alrededor de un centro de esparcimiento muy concurrido por la población y afortunadamente siempre tiene buenas ventas durante todo su horario de trabajo. Renueva sus productos de manera semanal llegando a invertir hasta 300 soles en cada compra. Lleva en esta actividad más de 12 años y en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus nietos cuando no se encuentran estudiando. En algunas ocasiones vende comida y refrescos en su casa dependiendo del clima y del capital económico con el que cuente en ese momento. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que puede tener un ingreso económico que ella misma genera que le permite solventar las necesidades de sus nietos. Se siente muy feliz desarrollando su trabajo por que se siente útil a la sociedad aunque muchas veces ha sentido desistir por el cansancio que en ocasiones siente debido a su edad, sin embargo, siempre obtiene nuevas energías y continúa realizando su labor con mucho optimismo. Espera continuar vendiendo mucho mejor por el bien de su familia. Este es el préstamo número 3 con MFP, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que son muy solidarios y responsables. Con el préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más golosinas como caramelos, hojuelas de maíz, chicles entre otros., además renovarás los utensilios que usa en la venta de refrescos comprando baldes y jarroncitos de plástico.
texts.en:
62-year-old Flora is a tenacious, entrepreneurial woman who has been a very hard worker since she was young.  She works non stop every day and always has reasons to keep going.  She has been a widow for many years but she has five children who were the fruit of her love.  Flora lives in her own home together with two grandchildren who are 19 years old and 11 years old.  She has brought them up since they were very young and works hard every day for them, in order to provide for them.

Flora's business is selling candies.  She has a tabletop on which she places all kinds of sweet treats such as chocolate, cookies, candies, gum and other snacks.  She works near a very busy leisure center and fortunately she always makes good sales throughout the day.  Flora renews her products weekly and invests up to 300 soles in each purchase.  She has been in this business for more than 12 years and sometimes receives help from her grandchildren when they are not studying.  Sometimes Flora also sells food and drink at home, depending on the weather and the capital that she has available at the time.  What she likes about her business is that it allows her to make income herself which she can use to cover her grandchildren's needs.  She feels very happy to be working because it makes her feel useful to society though she has often felt like stopping because of the tiredness she experiences as a result of her age.  However, she always finds new energy and continues working with a lot of optimism.  She hopes to improve her sales business for the well-being of her family.  

This is Flora's 3rd loan from MFP.  She is grateful to the people who will give her the loan she needs to increase her working capital and pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  She is happy to belong to her community bank because the members are very supportive and responsible.  Flora will invest her 1,000 soles loan in buying more sweet treats such as candies, cornflakes, gum, etc.  She will also renew the utensils that she uses in selling her soft drinks such as plastic jugs and buckets.

loans.use: to buy candies, cornflakes and gum, plastic jugs and buckets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Brima Lane Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone, about 31 years ago. Fatmata is married to a local chief. 

For 16 years now, Fatmata has been selling dishes, plastic bowls, etc. Fatmata and her group members are requesting a loan of 500,000 SLL each from Kiva lenders. 

With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses. This will lead to an increase in sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan to buy dishes, plastic bowls, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy dishes, plastic bowls, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 36 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 13, 7 and 2. In 2002, she established her meat shop business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy chickens and buffalo for her business.  

In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open-air butcher shops sell chicken, goat and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product, and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer  trabajadora y dinámica, además de alegre y sociable.  Es conviviente con Marcos quien es empleado y padre de  sus 04  hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y son su inspiración para seguir trabajando. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Flor es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de variados sabores y marcas, haciéndolas helar al gusto de sus clientes, para eso cuenta con un refrigeradora que compró con un préstamo y la instaló en su casa, desde allí  los atiende de manera amable y cordial, sabiendo que con ese trato se ganara la preferencia de sus clientes. 
Se inició hace más de 06 años con un préstamo particular, que le sirvió para realizar sus primeras compras, viendo la acogida que tuvo su negocio y con las ganancias que le dejaba los reinvirtió logrando comprar en mayores cantidades, y hasta el momento lo realiza con la ayuda de su pareja.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y por el consumo constante de las bebidas por lo caluroso de la zona.
Antes de empezar con su negocio, nos comenta que no tenía problemas, pero si el deseo de contar con una ocupación que la distrajera, además como contar con sus propios ingresos, así apoyar a su pareja con los gastos y no depender totalmente de él.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y aumentar su mercadería para ver crecer su negocio. Este es el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero, así se sentirá más segura para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, comenta le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal que viene apoyando a las personas con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 900 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de inmobiliarios para su local como sillas, mesas y otros, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Flor, 29, is a hardworking, dynamic woman in addition to being cheerful and sociable.  She lives with Marcos who is employed and the father of their four children who she loves very much and is her reason to continue working.  They live comfortably in their own house.  Flor’s activity is selling different brands of carbonated beverages in various flavors.  She chills them according to her customers’ wishes.  To do so, she has a refrigerator she bought with a loan and installed at home.  She kindly and cordially tends to them from there knowing that with this kind of treatment she will win over her customers’ loyalty.

She started more than 6 years ago with a private loan that helped her make her initial purchases.  When she saw the good way her business was welcomed she reinvested her profits to buy larger quantities and to date continues doing it with help from her partner.

She considers the business to be quite profitable because of the profits it nets and because beverages are constantly being consumed due to the hot weather in the zone.

She comments that prior to starting her business she had no problems but she did want to have an occupation to keep her busy as well as to earn her own income and help her spouse with expenses and not be completely dependent on him.

Therefore, seeing the good results she’s having, she plans to stay in business and increase her merchandise to make it grow.  This is her second MFP loan.  She is grateful for this new financing opportunity because she’ll feel more confident that she’ll advance with her business.  On the other hand, she comments that she likes the work in her communal bank that supports people with a line of credit to make their plans reality.

She will use the 900 new soles to buy furnishings like tables, chairs and others for her locale seeking the lowest prices for volume purchases so her profits will be higher.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her customers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Frasht Al-Rabia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Frasht Al-Rabia and consists of three ladies and one man who live in Taiz, Yemen.

Jamila, 42 years old, lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is married and has six children. She has worked in the traditional agricultural business of buying and selling sheep for many years. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy sheep. She is the woman who stands beside the man in the photo.

Jamila's goal is to increase her number of sheep in hopes of offering a better life to her family. She very much appreciates this help!

loans.use: to buy sheep for her agricultural business

loans.name: Patient Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born in the village of Matehbeh about 32 years ago. She is married to a teacher. The couple has four children, three of whom are in primary school and one is in secondary school. 

For 11 years now, Fatmata has been selling ready-to-wear clothes. She and her group members are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 SLL each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan to buy ready-to-wear clothes at wholesale to add to her current stock.

This is the third time this group is receiving a loan from Kiva lenders. Previous Kiva lenders' loans have made a huge impact in the lives and businesses of these borrowers. Having finished repaying their last Kiva loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan in order to further expand their respective businesses.

(This group is based in Makeni and not Lunsar as mentioned in their last Kiva loan. Sorry for the misinformation there.)

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Asaf Group

texts.en:
This is the second loan cycle for "Asaf" group. The six members are still together. They loved working with VisionFund and they got along well among themselves. These women live in a peaceful community where the main economic activities are related to the field. People grow maize, broad beans, beans, peas, etc. The group chose the name "Asaf" because they saw it on the Bible and they really liked it, though they do not know its meaning. They do know that it was the name of a person responsible for coordinating musicians in a ceremony. 

Emma is one of the members of this group. She is 38 years old and she is married to Leobardo, who is a salesman like her. They only had one child, but he is already self-sufficient. "We sell plastic containers such as blending machine glasses, plates, knives, cutlery, etc." But Emma also sells on her own material such as needles, threads, yarn, nail clippers, hair accessories, hair combs, etc. Emma is asking for a loan to buy these type of items. "It is good to have some more merchandise, especially fashionable."

The main difficulty these women have to face is the lack of money to expand their businesses. They have their establishments, but they need to get more merchandise. Besides, they do not take too many days to get rest. "I started selling product when I was 17; my mother-in-law was the one who taught me." Emma remembers coming with her husband's mother whenever she had something to sell and she loved the activity. Thanks to her business, Emma has the opportunity to meet lots of people, and some of them have even became her friends. "I want my business and my husband's to keep growing to raise our income because I want to improve the flooring in my house and to change the windows." 

All the members are quite happy and grateful for the loan they are about to get. Raquel will buy some tarps and blending machine glasses. Felisa will buy store merchandise. Angélica will buy backpacks and flags. Agustina and Norma will buy "jarcería" (cleaning products).

loans.use: to purchase blender jars, cutlery, clotheslines, cleaning clothes, etc.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Abdulslam

texts.en: Abdulslam is 33 years old. He is a happy man who treats everyone well because of his opportunities to get ahead. He has a house where lives with his four children in Taiz, Yemen. His educational background is a diploma. He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.name: 060312 Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food to sell. Hiền is 27 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 060312 Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu solidarity group. Hiền supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hiền hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase dry food to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucía, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, dinámica y muy sociable, tiene una relación de convivencia con Zenón quien es padre de sus 5 hijos de 15, 13, 9, 7 y 4 años de edad respectivamente y junto a ellos vive en su casa propia que obtuvo hace muchos años gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo. Lucía tiene como actividad laboral la venta de abarrotes. Tiene una pequeña tienda instalada en su vivienda en donde ofrece a la venta productos de primera necesidad caracterizados por su calidad y bajos precios, entre los artículos que ofrece tiene arroz, huevos, panes, leche, aceite y algunos embutidos. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 8 años y le va muy bien gracias a la buena clientela que ha obtenido con el paso de los años. Generalmente vende al contado, pero en ocasiones realiza ventas al crédito a personas que gozan de su confianza. Eventualmente recibe la ayuda de cónyuge quien le ayuda en la atención y en el traslado de la mercadería que renueva semanalmente. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que puede tener un ingreso económico que ella misma genera que le permite solventar las necesidades de su hogar y colaborar con su pareja en la repartición y manejo de los gastos básicos, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es que tiene que atender todo el día dejando muchas veces de lado algunas reuniones o salidas familiares, sin embargo siempre encuentra el tiempo necesario para hacerlo y ha aprendido a complementar bien su negocio con su vida en el hogar. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, ella por su parte se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual en el pago de sus cuotas así como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, asimismo se siente cómoda perteneciendo a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, leche y otros.
texts.en:
Lucía is 34 years old.  He is a hard worker, dynamic and friendly.  She is living with Zenón, who is the father of her five children ages 15, 13, 9, 7 and 4.  She lives with them in her own house, which she obtained years ago through effort and hard work.  

Lucía makes a living selling groceries.  She has a small store set up in her home where she sells basic products that are known for their quality and low prices.  Among the items that she offers are rice, eggs, bread, milk, cooking oil and some sausages.  She started this business about eight years ago and it is doing well thanks to the good clientele that she has built over the years.  For the most part, she requires cash only, but she sometimes offers credit to those whom she trusts.  She sometimes gets help from her partner, who helps her with cutomers and with the transport of merchandise, which she brings in weekly.  

What she likes about her job is that she generates her own income, which allows her to pay for household necessities and helps her partner with the distribution and management of basic expenses.  What she doesn't like is that she has to attend to the business all day, which has caused her to give up family gatherings and outings.  However, she now always finds the necessary time to be with her family and has learned to balance her business with her home life.  

This is loan number 4 with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support that offers her the guarantee that she can continue working without worries. For her part, she is committed to continue being a member who pays her loans off on time, just has she did with previous loans.  She also feels comfortable being a member of her communal bank, since all its members are very responsible and have solidarity among them.  She will invest the loan of 1000 nuevos soles in the purchase of more staple products such as rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk and other items.

loans.name: 3 Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khuông operates a business selling fish. Khuông has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to fish. 

Khuông is 50 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent child; the other two are grown up. 

She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 40303 Hoằng Hóa solidarity group. 

In 2001, Khuông joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Khuông has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Khuông hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish.

loans.name: 47-07-03-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh has a business raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future. Oanh is 35 years old, married, and has two children. 

She is the group leader of the 47-07-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents, her children are grown up.

In 2009, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Oanh has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Oanh has been involved in this business for six years. 

The main harship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

With her business profit, Oanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es: Loyda, tiene 51 años, es una mujer alegre, firme y trabajadora, es viuda pero tiene 2 hijos de 35 y 33 años a quienes dedicó muchos años de su vida para convertirlos en personas responsables y de provecho para la sociedad, cada uno de ellos ya es independiente y con su hogar formado. Vive en su casa propia que construyó su esposo cuando contrajeron nupcias. Vive sola y ahora trabaja para asegurar una vejez cómoda y tranquila. Loyda, se dedica a trabajar como contratista agro-forestal. Realiza su actividad en diversos proyectos forestales y en ocasiones también lo hace en proyectos agrícolas. Su función consiste en brindar la cantidad de mano de obra necesaria para que el trabajo a ejecutar esté listo en el tiempo establecido y con la calidad que requiere bajo los lineamientos determinados por la empresa o persona que contrata sus servicios. Dependiendo de la magnitud de la obra también varía el número de personas que emplea en su actividad pudiendo ser de 2 hasta 10 obreros y de acuerdo a ello compra todo lo necesario para abastecerse durante el tiempo que dure el desarrollo del proyecto. Lleva en este negocio más de 4 años y le va muy bien. Su trabajo le gusta porque sus servicios son muy bien remunerados y emplea periodos cortos de tiempo para realizarlo, le agrada ser la cabeza del grupo y dirigir el desarrollo de las funciones que se deben plasmar en el campo. Es una mujer independiente y espera seguir trabajando como hasta ahora lo ha hecho y consolidar su economía. Además desea criar aves de corral como gallinas, gallos y patos para venderlos en la temporada navideña. Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a continuar pagando puntualmente sus cuotas tal como le programen, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará combustible y víveres conformado por productos enlatados y otros para el campamento del nuevo proyecto que desarrollará. Además comprará aves de corral para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos.
texts.en:
Loyda is 51 years of age, and is a happy, strong and hard-working woman. She is widowed but has two children aged 35 and 33, to whom she dedicated many years throughout her life making sure that they became responsible people who were upstanding members of the community. Her children are both independent with their own homes. 

Loyda lives in her own house, which her husband built when they got married. She lives alone, and now works to make sure that she has a comfortable and peaceful old age.  She works as an agro-forestry contractor, working on numerous forestry projects and, on occasion, agricultural projects. Loyda works providing the necessary workforce to allow the work to be carried out on time and with the quality required by the person or company contracting the services. Depending on the size of the job, she also varies the number of people required. There can be between 2 and 10 workers and, based on the numbers, she buys all the supplies required for the duration of the project. 

Loyda has been working in this business for four years, and it’s doing really well. She likes her job because her services are very well-paid, and she only takes a short while to carry out the work. She likes being at the head of the group, managing the services that are carried out in the field. Loyda is an independent woman, and hopes to continue working as she has done up to now, consolidating her personal finances. She also wants to work raising poultry such as chickens, roosters and ducks, which she will then sell during the Christmas period. 

This is Loyda’s fifth loan from MFP. She is very happy with the financial support provided to her, as it gives her the security of knowing that she can keep working. She also says that she is committed to continue paying her loan installments on time. She is very happy to form a part of her communal bank, as all its members are very responsible and supportive. With the loan of 1,500 soles she has requested, Loyda will buy fuel and supplies (canned and other products) for the new project that she will carry out. She also wants to buy poultry to raise and then sell.

loans.use: To buy fuel, provisions and poultry.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Lili Milagros  es una mujer carismática, luchadora con ganas de seguir creciendo.  Es separada del padre de sus 02 hijos, siendo madre soltera. Vive sola con sus hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y son su inspiración para seguir trabajando. Vive en su propia su casa la cual compró con mucho esfuerzo. Lili Milagros se dedica a la venta de libros, pasamanerías y artículos de bazar, para esto cuenta con un local la cual está instalada en la casa de su mamá, de esa manera se ahorra en gastos de alquiler, y a la vez también vende productos de belleza que compra por catalogo, su negocio está siendo muy concurrida por los vecinos y extraños que pasan por la zona, a quienes  atiende con amabilidad.  
Su librería lleva más de 07 años de funcionamiento, tiempo que le valió para  ser muy conocida y concurrida, contando con el apoyo de su madre para la atención al público en sus ratos libres.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su trabajo porque le valió para hacerse muy conocida en la zona, y la ha traído ingresos económicos que le da la tranquilidad de poder brindarle lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos, comenta que escogió esta actividad por la necesidad de contar con un oficio y sentirse una mujer productiva, por tanto  tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo en su rubro y ampliar  su negocio. Este es el  préstamo número 02  con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias.
 Con el préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará útiles escolares, artículos de bazar, zapatos femeninos  de diversos modelos y muy variados a precio por mayor, considera que a mayor variedad mas acogida tendrá su negocio.
texts.en:
Lili Milagros is a charismatic woman who strives to continue growing.  She's separated from the father of her two children, so she's a single mother.  She lives alone with her children, whom she loves very much and who are her inspiration to continue working.  She lives in her own house, which she bought with great effort.

Lili Milagros makes a living selling books, notions, and hardware.  She has a space for this installed in her mother's house, so she saves on rent.  She also sells beauty products that she buys from a catalogue.  Her business is very crowded with the neighbors and strangers who are passing through the area, whom she serves kindly.

Her store has been in business for more than seven years, during which time it has become very well known and busy.  She has the support of her mother, who watches the store in her free time.  She considers her business profitable because of the good earnings it gives her.

She likes her job because it helped make her very well known in the area and has brought her income that gives her the peace of mind of being able to give her children the best.  She says she chose this work because she needed to have a trade and be a productive woman.  She very much wants to continue growing in her field and expand her business.

This is her second loan with MFP and she hopes for help so she can finalize her plans.  She also comments that she feels good about her communal bank because she considers the members to be responsible and supportive.

With the loan for 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy wholesale school supplies, hardware, and various styles of women's shoes.  She considers that with more variety her business will have better reception.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, notions, and women's shoes
